head.foreign: ARETAIOU KAPPADOKOU PERI AITIWN KAI SHMEIWN OCEWN PAQWN

p.foreign: A̓MBLÚTHTES , I̓́LIGGOI, TENÓNTWN BÁREA, FLEBW͂N E̓N TW͂ͅ TRAXH́LWͅ PLHRẂSIES KAÌ DIATÁSIES, NAUTÍA TE POLLH̀ MÈN E̓PÌ SITÍOIS, OU̓X H̔́KISTA DÈ KAÌ E̓P’ A̓SITÍHͅSI KAÌ BLHXRH́·
p.note: In all the former editions, instead of TE POLLH̀, we read TÀ POLLÀ and, with the exception of that of Dr. Ermerins, all have KAÌ before BLHXRH́. The Latin translation of this clause by Wigan, Kuhn, and Ermerins, is this: "Nausea præcipué quidem post cibum, sed quæ per abstinentiam quoque lenté continuat," which is evidently very loose and vague. That of Crassus is far more strict and accurate: "Nαυσεα φρεθυεντιυς θυιδεμ ε ξιβις, νον μινιμ ταμεν ετ αβ ινεδια πυσιλλα θυæδαμ ναυσεα σεθυιτυρ." The English translation of the text as it formerly stood would run thus: "Nausea for the most part, indeed, after food; but also, not unfrequently, slight nausea after abstinence." It appears to me, however, that the meaning is so much improved by the slight change I have ventured to make, that I flatter myself no argument is required to prove it to be the true reading. The contrast between POLLH̀ in the one case, and BLHXRH̀ in the other, is most suitable to the sense. That the repetition of KAÌ is legitimate in this clause of the sentence, will not be questioned by any one who is familiar with the style of Galen. See, for example, De Locis Affectis, v.i., prope initium; t.iii. p. 296, ed. Basil.
p.foreign: KAÌ FLÉGMA E̓MEI͂TAI SUXNÓN· A̓POSITÍH KAÌ A̓PEYÍH E̓PÌ SMIKROI͂SI E̓DÉSMASI· FUSẂDEES, E̓PHRMÉNOI U̔POXÓNDRIA. TÁDE MÈN OU̓͂N DIHNEKÉA.
HN DÈ PLHSÍON H̓́DH

note.p: Tηε ξομμον ρεαδινγ ιν τηε MSS. ις EI̓́DEOS, ωηιξη ις εϝιδεντλψ ιναδμισσιβλε. Pετιτ, ιν ηις Cομμενταρψ, συγγεστς τηατ τηε τρυε ρεαδινγ ις DÉOS H̔ͅ. Wιγαν αλσο πρεφερς PLHSÍON EI̓́H DÉOS. Eρμερινς αξξορδινγλψ ρεαδς PLHSÍON E̓́Hͅ DÉOSM. Nονε οφ τηεσε εδιτορς, ηοωεϝερ, ρεφερς το ανψ αυτηοριτψ φορ τηις εχπρεσσιον, ωηιξη αππεαρς το με θυαιντ ανδ υννατυραλ--"βυτ ιφ τηε δρεαδ οφ α παροχψσμ βε ατ ηανδ." I πρεφερ H̓́DH ον τηε αυτηοριτψ οφ μανψ παραλλελ πασσαγες, ας φορ εχαμπλε--PLHSÍON DÈ H̓́DH TOU͂ FRENÍZEIN O̓́NTES, Gαλεν, de loc. affect. ιιι.; E̓NSTÁNTOS DÈ H̓́DH TOU͂ SUMPTẂMATOS, P. Æ. ιιι. 5, ιν τηε ξηαπτερ ον επιλεπσψ. Eρμερινς ϝερψ προπερλψ ρεστορες ιτ, ιν ανοτηερ πασσαγε οφ ουρ αυτηορ, ωηερε H̔́DE ηαδ βεεν συβστιτυτεδ φορ ιτ ̔Sψμπτ. διυτ. μορβ. ι. 9̓. Iνδεεδ H̓́DH, ιν συξη ξασες, οξξυρς φρεθυεντλψ ιν τηε ωορκς οφ ουρ αυτηορ.

Mορεοϝερ, ιν τηε μαργιν οφ τηε ξελεβρατεδ Rεισκε’ς ξοπψ οφ Hενισξη’ς εδιτιον, τηερε ις φουνδ τηις εμενδατιον--H̓́DH DÉOS. Sεε G. Dινδορφ’ς Aππενδιχ το Kυην’ς εδιτιον. Tηε Lατιν τρανσλατιον οφ Cρασσυς ωουλδ αγρεε ϝερψ ωελλ ωιτη τηε ρεαδινγ I προποσε; ωηιλε ιτ ις υνσυιταβλε το τηε τεχτ ωηεν DÉOS ις αδμιττεδ· "Quum vero accessio appropinquat."

DÁKTULOI GOU͂N MEGÁLOI XEIRW͂N H̓̀ PODW͂N CUNÉLKONTAI, KAÌ PÓNOS KAÌ NÁRKH KAÌ TRÓMOS E̔́PETAI, KAÌ E̓S KEFALH̀N TOUTÉWN H̔ O̔RMH̀ H̔͂KEN. H̔́DE MÉNTOI A̓PÁTH GÍGNETAI O̔KÓSOISI TÓDE PRW͂TON TÒ KAKÒN CUNÉPESE · OI̔͂S DÈ CÚNHQES TÒ PÁQOS, H̓̀N E̓PÍHͅ MÈN H̔ NOU͂SOS, E̓S DÁKTULON DÈ H̓́DH A̓FÍKHTAI, H̓̀ A̓PÓ TEU A̓́RCHTAI, CUNH́QEAS

A̓RWGOÙS KALÉOUSI TOÙS PAREÓNTAS, PROGNẂSI TOU͂ MÉLLONTO U̔P’ E̓MPEIRÍHS· DIASFÍGGEIN TE KAÌ A̓NAKLÁEIN KAÌ SUNTEÍNEIN DÉONTAI TÀ KATÁRXONTA MÉREA· KAÌ AU̓TOÌ DÈ E̔WUTÉOISIN E̔́LKOUSI TÀ MÉREA, O̔́KWSPER TH̀N NOU͂SON E̓CAIROÚMENOI· KAÌ SFÉWN H̔ TOIH́DE E̓PIKOURÍH KOTÈ KAÌ E̓S H̔MÉRHN TH͂N SHMASÍHN DIẂSATO.
p.note: The common reading in the MSS. is KAÌ E̓S TH̀N H̔METÉRHN SHMASÍHN DIẂSATO. In the margin of the edition of Henisch we find H̔MÉRHN, which is adopted by Wigan. Ermerins transposes TH̀N from before H̔MÉRHN, as above.

div3.p: EN DÈ TH͂ͅ SHMASÍHͅ A̓NAISQH́TWS MÈN KÉETAI W̔́NQRWPOS, XEI͂RES DÉ OI̔ SPASMW͂ͅ CUNÉRXONTAI, SKÉLEA OU̓ DIAPEPLIGMÉNA MOU͂NON, A̓LLÀ TH͂ͅDE KA̓KEI͂SE BALLÓMENA AU̓TOI͂S A̓PÒ TW͂N TENÓNTWN. E̓SFAGMÉNOISI TAÚROISI H̔́DE I̓KÉLH H̔ CUMFORH́ · AU̓XH̀N A̓GKÚLOS, KEFALH̀ POIKÍLWS DIÁSTROFOS · A̓́LLOTE MÈN GÀR E̓S TÒ PRHNÈS TOCOU͂TAI, EU̓͂TE E̓S TÒ STÉRNON H̔ GÉNUS E̓REÍDEI, A̓́LLOTE DÈ E̓S TÒ METÁFRENON A̓NAKLA͂TAI, O̔́KWS TOI͂S A̓PÒ TH͂S KÓMHS E̔LKOMÉNOISI BÍHͅ, EU̓͂TE E̓́NQA H̓̀ E̓́NQA E̓PÌ TOÙS W̓́MOUS I̔ZÁNEI. XÁSKOUSI MÉGA, STÓMA CHRÒN, GLW͂SSA PROMH́KHS, W̔S KAÌ KÍNDUNON TRẂMATOS MEGÁLOU GÍGNESQAI, H̓̀ A̓POTOMH͂S, EI̓́ KOTE SPASMW͂ͅ CUNEREÍSOUSIN OI̔ O̓DÓNTES. O̓FQALMOÌ E̓NDEDINHMÉNOI, BLÉFARA TÀ POLLÀ DIÉXONTA CÙN PALMW͂ͅ· H̓̀N DÈ E̓PIMÚSAI KOTÈ E̓QÉLOIEN, OU̓ CUMBÁLLOUSI TÀ BLÉFARA, W̔S KAÌ TÀ LEUKÀ O̔RH͂SQAI E̓C U̔POFÁSIOS. O̓FRÚES A̓́LLOTE MÈN E̓S TÒ MESÓFRUON A̓NEIMÉN AI, Dr. Ermerins, on pure conjecture, substitutes CUNHGMÉNAI, as I think unnecessarily. ANEIMÉNAI may be interpreted literally, "inclining," i. e. "drawn upwards." See Foes Œc. Hippocrat., under A̓NIOU͂TAI. Would not A̓NIÉMENAI be a suitable reading? I have translated the passage accordingly. O̔́KWS TOI͂S XALEPAÍNOUSI, A̓́LLOTE DÈ E̓S TOÙS KROTÁFOUS A̓PHGMÉNAI, POLLÓN TI MA͂LLON, W̔S TÒ DÉRMA PERÌ TÒ MÉTWPON SFÓDRA PERITETÁSQAI KAÌ TÀS TOU͂ MESOFRÚOU R̔UTÍDAS E̓CALHLÍFQAI· MH͂LA E̓RUQRÀ, PALLÓMENA·
XEÍLEA, KOTÈ MÈN A̓́MFW E̓S O̓CÙ MEMUKÓT A, A̓́LLOTE DÈ E̓S TÀ PLÁGIA A̓PHGMÉNA, EU̓͂TE TOI͂SI O̓DOU͂SI PERITEÍNETAI, TOI͂SI MEIDIW͂SI O̔MOÍWS.

EN AU̓́CHͅ DÈ TOU͂ KAKOU͂ KAÌ PELIDNÓTHS TOU͂ PROSẂPOU PROSGÍGNETAI, A̓GGEÍWN TW͂N E̓N TW͂ͅ AU̓XÉNI DIÁTASIS, W̔S E̓N PNIGÌ A̓FWNÍH, A̓NAISQHSÍH , KAÌ EI̓ MÉGA E̓MBOH͂ͅS· MUGMÒS DÈ KAÌ STENAGMÒS H̔ FWNH̀, KAÌ H̔ A̓NAPNOH̀ PNÌC, W̔S A̓PAGXOMÉNWͅ· The common reading before Ermerins was KAÌ H̔ PNÍC. I have cheerfully adopted, also, his emendation of NUGMÒS into MUGMÒS, as suggested by Petit; and only wonder that neither of them refers to the Eumenides of Æschylus (l. 116) as an authority for this meaning of the term. SFUGMOÌ SFODROÌ KAÌ TAXÉES, KAÌ SMIKROÌ E̓N TH͂ͅSI A̓RXH͂ͅSI· MEGÁLOI DÈ KAÌ BRADÉES KAÌ NWQROÌ E̓PÌ TW͂ͅ TÉLEI, A̓́TAKTOI DÈ E̓S TÒ CÚNOLON · AI̓DOÍWN CÚNTASI S. TÁDE MÈN OU̓͂N E̓S TÉLOS TH͂S SHMASÍHS PÁSXOUSI.

HN DÈ E̓S A̓́FESIN A̓FIKNÉWNTAI TOU͂ KAKOU͂, OU̓͂RA AU̓TÓMATA, KOILÍHS PERÍPLUSI S· METECET ÉROISI DÈ KAÌ GONH͂S A̓PÓKRISIS TH͂ͅ QLÍYI KAÌ PIÉSI TW͂N A̓GGEÍWN, H̓̀ GARGALISMW͂ͅ TOU͂ PÓNOU, KAÌ U̔GRASÍHS PROKLH́SI. GÍGNONTAI GÀR E̓N NEÚROISI PÓNOI KAÌ TOI͂SDE. STÓMA DÍUGRON, FLÉGMA POLLÒN, PAXÙ KAÌ YUXRÒN, KAÌ EI̓ E̔́LKOIS AU̓TÒ, E̓PÌ MA͂LLON A̓̀N PLH͂QOS AU̓TÉOU MHRÚSAIO. H̓̀N DÈ XRÓNWͅ MAKRW͂ͅ KAÌ PÓNWͅ POLLW͂ͅ BRASQH͂ͅ MÈN TÀ E̓́NDON TOU͂ QẂRHKOS, PNEU͂MA DÈ E̓GKATEIRXQÈN TÀ PÁNTA SEÍSHͅ, SPASMÒS DÈ KAÌ TÁRAXOS TW͂N AU̓TÉWN E̓́Hͅ, KLÚDWN DÈ U̔GRW͂N A̓NAPLE̓́Hͅ E̓S TÀS DIAPNOÀS, STÓMA KAÌ R̔I͂NA, SÙN U̔GRW͂ͅ DÈ TÒ PNEU͂MA, A̓́NESIS DH̀ TH͂S PRÓSQEN PNÍCIOS A̔PÁNTWN E̓́OIKE. A̓FRÒN DÈ A̓POPTÚOUSI W̔́SPER E̓PÌ TOI͂SI MEGÁLOISI PNEÚMASI H̔ QÁLASSA TH̀N A̓́XNHN·Homer, Iliad. iv. 421, et seq. TH̀N MÈN GÀR KATÓPIN TOU͂ NOSÉONTOS A̓NÁKLISIN O̓PISQÓTONON KALÉOMEN, TW͂N TH͂ͅDE PEPONQÓTWN NEÚRWN. div3.p: PROFÁSIES DÈ TW͂NDE MURÍAI. KAÌ GÀR E̓PÌ TRẂMATI FILÉOUSI GÍGNESQAI U̔MÉNOS, H̓̀ MUW͂N, H̓̀ NEÚRWN NUGÉNTWN, EU̓͂TE TÀ POLLÀ QNH́SKOUSI, E̓PÌ TRẂMATI GÀR SPASMÒS QANÁSIMON· Hippocrat. Aph. v. 2. SPA͂TAI DÈ KAÌ E̓PÌ A̓MBLẂMA TI H̔ GUNH̀, A̓TÀR KAÌ H̔́DE OU̓ MÁLA PERIGÍGNETAI. KAÍ TEU PATÁCANTOS MEGÁLWS TÒN AU̓XÉNA METECÉTEROI SPW͂NTAI. KAÌ YÚCIS DÈ KÁRTA I̓SXURH̀ GÍGNETAI AI̓TÍH. DIÀ TÓDE XEI͂MA MÈN MÁLISTA PÁNTWN TÍKTEI TÁDE TÀ PÁQEA, DEÚTERON DÈ H̓͂R SÙN TW͂ͅ METOPẂRWͅ, QÉROS DÈ H̔́KISTA, EI̓ MH̀ KATÁRCHͅ TRW͂MA H̓̀ NOÚSWN A̓LLODAPW͂N E̓PIDHMÍH · GUNAI͂KES DÈ A̓NDRW͂N SPW͂NTAI MÈN MA͂LLON, O̔́TI YUXRAÍ· A̓TÀR AI̔́DE PERIGÍGNONTAI MA͂LLON, O̔́TI U̔GRAÍ. H̔LIKÍAI DÈ, PAI͂DES MÈN SUNEXÈS, A̓LL’ OU̓ MA͂LLON QNH́SKOU SI, O̔́TI CÚNHQES KAÌ OI̓KEI͂ON PÁQOS· NÉOI DÈ TOUTÉWN H̔͂SSON PÁSXOUSI, MA͂LLON DÈ QNH́SKOUSI, A̓KMÁZONTES H̔́KISTA· GÉRONTES DÈ PÁNTWN MA͂LLON KAÌ PÁSXOUSI KAÌ QNH́SKOU SI. AI̓TÍH GÀR YÚCIS KAÌ CHRÓTHS

GH́RAOS, KAÌ QANÁTOU H̔́DE FÚSIS. The common reading is QANÁTOU H̔ FÚSIS, to which Ermerins adds H̔́DE, which I have substituted for H̔, so as to produce a suitable reading with little violence to the text. H̓̀N DÈ H̔ YÚCIS E̓́Hͅ SÙN U̔GRW͂ͅ, A̓SINÉSTEROÍ TE KAÌ A̓SFALÉSTEROI EI̓S KÍNDUNON OI̔ SPASMOÍ.

CÚNESTI MÈN AU̓TÉOISI, A̓QRÓON MÈN EI̓RH͂SQAI, A̔́PASI PÓNOS KAÌ E̓́NTASIS TENÓNTWN KAÌ R̔ÁXEOS, KAÌ MUW͂N TW͂N E̓N GNÁQOISI KAÌ QẂRHKI, E̓REÍDOUSI GÀR TH̀N KÁTW GÉNUN PRÒS TH̀N A̓́NW, W̔S MHDÈ MOXLOI͂SIN H̓̀ SFHNÌ DIÀ R̔HÏDÍWS STH͂SAI DÚNASQA I. H̓̀N DÈ KAÌ BÍHͅ DIAGAGẀN TOÙS O̓DÓNTAS E̓NSTÁCHͅ TIS U̔GRÒN, OU̓ KATAPÍNOUSI, A̓LL’ E̓KXÉOUSI, H̓̀ E̓N TW͂ͅ STÓMATI I̓́SXOUSI, H̓́ E̓S TÀS R̔I͂NAS A̓NAKÓPTETAI. O̔́ TE GÀR I̓SQMÒS SUNEREÍDETAI KAÌ TÀ PARÍSQMIA SKLHRÀ KAÌ E̓NTETAMÉNA E̓ÓNTA OU̓ CUMPÍPTEI EI̓S TH̀N E̓́NQLIYIN TOU͂ KATAPINOMÉNOU. PRÓSWPA E̓RUQRÀ, PEPOIKILMÉNA, O̓FQALMOÌ MIKROU͂ DEI͂N A̓TENÉES, MÓLIS PERIDINOÚMENOI, PNÌC I̓SXURH̀, A̓NAPNOH̀ KAKH̀, XEIRW͂N KAÌ SKELÉWN TÁSIS, MÚES PALLÓMENOI, PRÓSWPA POIKÍLWS DIÁSTROFA, MH͂LA KAÌ XEÍLEA TROMẂDEA, GÉNUS PALLOMÉNH, O̓DÓNTWN A̓́RABOS· E̓P’ A̓́LLWͅ D’ A̓́N TINI KAÌ TÀ W̓͂TA, E̓GẀ DÈ E̓QHEÚMHN KAÌ E̓QWÚMAZON. OU̓͂RA E̓PISXÓME NA MÉXRI DUSOURÍHS KARTERH͂S, H̓̀ AU̓TOMÁTWS E̓KXEÓMENA QLIBOMÉNHS TH͂S KÚSTEOS. TÁDE MÈN OU̓͂N CÙN PÁSHͅ I̓DÉHͅ SPASMW͂N.
IDIA DÈ E̔KÁSTHS, TETÁNOU MÈN H̔ E̓S EU̓QÙ A̓PÓTASIS O̔́LOU A̓STRABH̀S PÁNTH KAÌ A̓KLINH̀S, EU̓QÉA DÈ KAÌ SKÉLEA KAÌ XEI͂RES.

p.foreign: OPISQÓTONOS DÈ KATÓPIN A̓GKÚLLEI TÒN A̓́NQRWPON, W̔S TH̀N KEFALH̀N A̓NAKEKLASMÉNHN MESSHGÙ TW͂N W̓MOPLATÉWN KÉESQAI, BRÓGXOS E̓CÉXEI, GÉNUS TÀ POLLÀ DIÍ̈STATAI, SPÁNION DÈ EU̓͂TE CUNEREÍ DEI TH͂ͅ A̓́NW, R̔WXMÒS H̔ A̓NAPNOH̀, PROPETÉES KOILÍHN KAÌ QẂRHKA. div3.p: KATÓPIN KEKLASMÉNAI, SKÉLEA CUGKEKAMMÉNA· E̓NANTÍWS GÀR I̓GNÚHͅ KATÓPIN The common reading, KAKÓN TI, is obviously at fault. The present reading is adopted by Ermerins, only using I̓GNÚHͅ in place of I̓GNÚH. Still there is something unsatisfactory in the text. IGNÙS and I̓GNÚH are applied, in strictness, to the back part of the thigh at its lower extremity. KÁMPTETAI.

HN DÈ E̓S TÒ E̓́MPROSQEN E̔́LKWNTAI, KURTOÌ MÈN TÀ NW͂TA, E̓P’ I̓͂SON TOI͂SI METAFRÉNOISI TW͂N I̓SXÍWN E̓CWQEUMÉNWN· R̔ÁXIS O̔́LH E̓S EU̓QÚ· Ermerins adopts this reading, partly on the suggestions of Petit, and partly from the margin of Henisch. It is also the reading of the Askew MS. The common reading is E̔́LKEI. Neither the one nor the other is quite satisfactory. KORUFH̀ PRHNH̀S, KEFALH̀ E̓S QẂRHKA SUNNENEUKUI͂A, GÉNUS E̓PÌ TOI͂SI STÉRNOISI PEPHGUI͂A, XEI͂RES SUNHREISMÉNAI, SKÉLEA E̓KTETAMÉNA . H̓̀N DÈ E̓S TÒ ZH͂N E̓́TI DIARKÉHͅ, TH͂S A̓NAPNOH͂S, EI̓ KAÌ KAKH͂S, SUNTELOUMÉNHS D’ OU̓͂N , E̓S TÒ PRÓSQEN OU̓ TOCOU͂NTAI MÓNON, A̓LLÀ KAÌ SFAIROU͂NTAI, W̔S TH̀N KEFALH̀N E̓PÌ TOI͂SI GOÚNASI E̓́XEIN, KAÌ TÀ SKÉLEA KAÌ TÀ NW͂TA E̓S TÒ PRÓSQEN KEKLÁSQAI, W̔S DOKÉEIN E̓S I̓GNÚHN KATÀ GÓNU TÒ A̓́RQRON E̓CW͂SQAI.

PÍMPLHSI GÀR TH̀N XẂRHN TOU͂ STÓMATOS, KAÌ TÒ PERITTÒN AU̓TÉHS U̔PÈR TOÙS O̓DÓNTAS E̓KXEI͂TAI. KUNÁGXH TÓDE KALÉETAI, H̓́TOI TW͂ͅ CUNEXÉÏ PÁQEÏ TW͂NDE TW͂N ZẂWN, H̓̀ TW͂ͅ CUNH́QEÏ TH͂S PROBOLH͂S TH͂S GLẂSSHS, KAÌ E̓N U̔GEÍHͅ.

TW͂ͅ E̔TÉRWͅ DÈ EI̓́DEÏ TÀ E̓NANTÍA CÚNESTI · CÚMPTWSIS TW͂N O̓RGÁNWN, KAÌ I̓SXNÓTHS E̓PÌ MA͂LLON TH͂S E̔KÁSTOU FÚSIOS· KAÌ PNÌC KARTERH̀, W̔S DOKÉEIN SFÍSI AU̓TÉOISI E̓S QẂRHKA E̓S TÒ A̓FANÈS E̓GKEKRÚFQAI TH̀N FLEGMON H̀N A̓MFÌ KARDÍHN KAÌ PNEÚMONA · SUNÁGXHN TH́NDE KALÉOMEN, OI̔͂ON SUNEÚOUSAN E̓́NDON KAÌ A̓́GXOUSAN. E̓MOÌ DÈ DOKÉEI AU̓TÉOU TOU͂ PNEÚMATOS MOÚNOU TÒ KAKÒN E̓́MMENAI, TROPH̀N PONHRH̀N E̓S TÒ QERMÓTA TON KAÌ CHRÓTATON TREPOMÉNOU, A̓́NEUQEN TOU͂ SẂMATÓS TINOS FLEGMON H͂S. E̓́STI DÈ OU̓ MÉGA TÒ QWU͂MA. KAÌ GÀR E̓N XARWNÍOISIN AI̔ PNÍCIES OU̓ SWMÁTWN PÁQEÏ O̓CUTÁTWͅ GÍGNONTAI, A̓LLÀ KAÌ MIA͂ͅ EI̓SPNOH͂ͅ QNH́SKOUSI W̔́NQRWPOI, PRÌN TÒ SW͂MA KAKÓN TI PAQÉEIN. A̓TÀR KAÌ A̓PÒ GLẂSSHS KUNÒS EI̓SPNEÚSANTOS MOU͂NON E̓S TH̀N A̓NAPNOH̀N, OU̓́TI MH̀N E̓NDAKÓNTOS , LUSSA͂ͅ O̔ A̓́NQRWPOS. TOIH́NDE OU̓͂N TH͂S A̓NAPNOH͂S TH̀N TROPH̀N OU̓K A̓DÚNATON GÍGNESQAI E̓́NDOQEN · E̓PEÌ KAÌ A̓́LLA MURÍA TW͂N E̓N A̓NQRẂPWͅ

TH̀N AU̓TH̀N I̓DÉHN TOI͂S E̓́CWQEN AI̓TÍOIS I̓́SXEI. XULOÌ FQEÍRONTES E̓́SWQEN KAÌ E̓́CWQEN· A̓TÀR KAÌ NOU͂SOI FARMÁKOISI DHLHTHRÍOISI I̓́KELAI, KAÌ A̓PÒ FARMÁKWN E̓MÉOUSI O̔KOI͂A PURETW͂N EI̔́NEKA. O̔́QEN OU̓D’ A̓PEOIKÒS E̓N TW͂ͅ LOIMW͂ͅ TW͂ͅ E̓N AQH́NHͅSI METECETÉROUS DOKÉEIN EI̓S TÀ FRÉATA E̓N TW͂ͅ PEIRAIEI͂ U̔PÒ PELOPONNHSÍWN E̓MBEBLH͂SQAI FÁRMAKA. OU̓ GÀR CUNÍESAN W̔́NQRWPOI TÒ CUNÒN TOU͂ KAKOU͂ TOU͂ LOIMẂDEOS PRÒS TÀ DHLHTH́R IA.

CÚNESTI DÈ TOI͂SI MÈN KUNAGXIKOI͂SI FLEGMONH̀ PARISQMÍWN, FARUGGÉQROU, PANTÒS TOU͂ STÓMATOS. GLW͂SSA PROPETH̀S U̔PÈR TOÙS O̓DÓNTAS KAÌ TÀ XEÍLEA· SIELOXÓOI, FLÉGMA PAXÚTATON, A̓PORRÉON KAÌ YUXRÓN· E̓RUQROÌ TÀ PRÓSWPA, KAÌ E̓PHRMÉNOI, O̓FQALMOÌ E̓CÍSXONTES , A̓NAPETÉES, E̓CÉRUQROI · TÒ POTÒN E̓S TÀS R̔I͂NAS A̓NAKÓPTETAI· PÓNOI KARTEROÌ, A̓LLÀ KAÌ U̔PÒ TH͂S PNIGÒS SUNDIWKÓMENOI A̓MAUROU͂NTAI. QẂRHC KAÌ KARDÍH FLÉGETAI· POQH̀ YUXROU͂ H̓ÉROS· EI̓SPNÉOUSI DÈ MIKRÒN PÁNU, E̓́S TE KAÌ A̓PEPNÍXQHSAN, E̓MFRAGEÍSHS TH͂S E̓S TÒN QẂRHKA DIÓDOU. E̓NÍOISI DÈ E̓S PNEÚMONA H̔ CÚNDOSIS R̔HÏDÍWS · OI̔ DÈ METASTÁSI QNH́SKOUSI· PURETOÌ NWQROÌ, MALAKOÌ, OU̓DÈN W̓FELÉONTES . EI̓ DÉ TWͅ E̓S A̓GAQÒN TRÉPOITO, A̓POSTÁSIES GÍGNONTAI E̓́NQA KAÌ E̓́NQA PAR’ OU̓͂S E̓́CW, H̓̀ E̓́NDON E̓S TÀ PARÍSQMIA· KH̓̀N MÈN CÙN NÁRKHͅ, MH̀ KÁRTA BRADÉWS, PERIGÍGNONTAI MÈN, CÙN PÓNWͅ DÈ KAÌ KINDÚNWͅ · H̓̀N DÈ TREPOMÉNWN E̓S A̓PÓSTASIN O̓́GKOS MÉZWN U̔POGÍGNHTAI , E̓S KORUFH̀N TH͂S A̓POSTÁSIOS A̓NISTAMÉNHS, A̓QRÓON PNÍGONTAI. TÁDE MÈN TÀ KUNÁGXHS EI̓́DEA.

CUNÁGXHS DÈ, SÚMPTWSIS, I̓SXNÓTHS, W̓XRÓTHS SÚNESTI · O̓FQALMOÌ KOI͂LOI, EI̓́SW DEDUKÓTES· FÁRUGC KAÌ GARGARÉWN A̓NESPASMÉNOI, PARÍSQMIA E̓PÌ MA͂LLON PROSÍZONTA, A̓FWNÍH · PNÌC H̔ TOU͂DE TOU͂ EI̓́DEOS TH͂S PRÓSQEN POLLÓN TI KRATAIOTÉRH, E̓N QẂRHKI E̓ÓNTOS TOU͂ KAKOU͂, E̓́NQA H̔ A̓RXH̀ TH͂S A̓NAPNOH͂S · OI̔ DÈ O̓CÚTATOI QNH́SKOUSI AU̓TH͂MAR, E̓́SQ’ O̔́PH KAÌ PRÌN KALÉSASQAI

TÒN I̓HTRÒN, OI̔ DÈ KAÌ E̓SKALESÁMENOI OU̓DÈN W̓́NANTO. A̓PÉQANON GÀR PRÌN H̓̀ TÒN I̓HTRÒN E̓PÌ TÉXNHͅ XRH́SASQAI. O̔KÓSOS DÈ E̓S A̓GAQÒN TRÉPETAI, E̓PIFLEGMAÍNEI PÁNTA, E̓S A̔́PER E̓S TÒ E̓́CW H̔ FLEGMON H̀ E̓CWKEÍLEI , W̔S KUNÁGXHN A̓PÒ SUNÁGXHS GÍGNESQAI
p.note: I have followed Wigan and Ermerins in interchanging the places of SUNÁGXH and KUNÁGXH as they stood in all the MSS. I have also, like them, substituted O̔KÓSOIS for O̔KÓSON; and have added E̓S before A̔́PER, on the authority of Ermerins. But all this patchwork still leaves the sentence in a very unsatisfactory condition.
p.foreign: A̓GAQÒN DÈ KAÌ E̓N QẂRHKI OI̓́DHMA KARTERÒN, H̓̀ E̓RUSÍPELAS E̓MFANÉWS. KAÌ I̓HTRÒS DÈ A̓GAQÒS H̓̀ SIKÚHͅ EI̓S TÒN QẂRHKA TÒ KAKÒN A̓NH́GAGE, H̓̀ SÍNHPI E̓S TÀ STÉRNA KAÌ E̓S TÀ PARÀ GNÁQOUS MÉREA E̓PIQEÌS, EI̔́LKUSE E̓́CW KAÌ DIÉPNEUSE· METECETÉROISI DÈ E̓S MÈN BRAXÙ TÒ KAKÒN U̔PÒ TOUTÉWN A̓PELÁQH E̓́CW, A̓PETAQÈN
p.note: Ermerins has substituted the two words above for A̓PETÁQH and A̓POLUQÈN, which have no proper signification in this place. It must be admitted, that although some improvement, the substituted terms are not quite suitable; as it can scarcely be said, that an internal disease is "driven outwards" by an external application.
p.foreign: DÈ A̓QRÓWS E̓PALINDRÓMHSE KAÌ E̓́PNICE.
p.note: The common reading is E̓PÁNHCE. The other word occurs in the Codex Philipp., and is no doubt the true reading.

p.foreign: PROFÁSIES DÈ MURÍAI, YÚCIES MA͂LLON, H̔͂SSON E̓KKAÚSIES, PLHGAÌ, O̓STÉWN I̓XQÚWN DIAPÁRSIES E̓S TÀ PARÍSQMIA, YUXROPOSÍAI, MÉQAI, PLHSMONAÌ, KAÌ TÀ A̓PÒ TH͂S A̓NAPNOH͂S KAKÁ.

head.foreign: KEF. H’. PERÌ TW͂N KATÀ TH̀N KIONÍDA PAQW͂N.

p.foreign: TÒ A̓PÒ TH͂S U̔PERẂHS E̓KKREMÈN SW͂MA STERRÒN, MESHGÙTW͂N PARISQMÍWN, KÍWN KAÌ GARGAREẀN KALÉETAI. STAFULH̀ GÀR PÁQEÓS E̓STIN OU̓́NOMA. NEU͂RON DÉ E̓STI H̔ KIONÌS TH̀N FÚSIN, A̓LL’ U̔GRÓN· E̓N GÀR U̔GRW͂ͅ KÉETAI XWRÍWͅ. O̔́DE OU̓͂N O̔ GARGARE ẀN PLEU͂NA PÁSXEI PÁQEA. KAÌ GÀR E̓PÌ FLEGMON H͂ͅ PAXÚNETAI, I̓͂SOS A̓PÒ TH͂S BÁSIOS A̓́XRI TOU͂ PÉRATOS A̓́KROU, E̓PIMH́KHS GIGNÓMENOS , KAÌ E̓RÚQHMA I̓́SXEI. KÍWN DÈ TOU͂DE TOU͂ PÁQEOS

H̔ E̓PÍKLHSIS. EI̓ KATÀ PÉRAS MOU͂NON STROGGÚ LLETAI, KAÌ MEGÉQEÏ PELIDNÒS GÍGNETAI, KAÌ U̔POMELAN ÍZEI, STAFULH̀ E̓PẂNUMON TÓDE TÒ PÁQOS. PÁNTA GÀR I̓́KELA AU̓TÉHͅ, KAÌ SXH͂MA, KAÌ XROIH̀, KAÌ MÉGEQOS. TRÍTON PÁQOS E̓STÌ U̔MÉNWN, E̓́NQA KAÌ E̓́NQA, OI̔͂ÓN TI LÉPEA PLATÉA, H̓̀ NUKTERÍDWN PTÉRUGES E̓KFAÍNONTAI· I̔MÁNTION TÓDE KALÉETAI. I̔MA͂SI GÀR I̓́KELAI AI̔ TW͂N U̔MÉNWN EI̓S PLÁTOS E̔CAPLẂSIES. E̓I DÈ E̓S LEPTÒN KAÌ EU̓MH́KH U̔MÉNA TELEUTA͂ͅ KIONÌS, OI̔͂ÓN TI OU̓RÍAXON KATÀ PÉRAS I̓́SXOUSA, KRÁSPEDON TH̀N E̓PWNUMÍHN I̓́SXEI. GÍGNETAI DÈ TÓDE KAÌ AU̓TOMÁTWS MÈN E̓K R̔EÚMATOS, O̔́KWSPER KAÌ E̔́TERA· A̓TÀR KAÌ A̓PÒ TOMH͂S E̓PIKARSÍHS, E̓GKATALIPÓNTOS TOU͂ I̓HTROU͂ U̔MÉNA KATÀ MÍAN PLEURH́N. H̓̀N DÈ DIKRÓA U̔MÉSI DISSOI͂SI E̓KKREMÉSI E̓́NQA KAÌ E̓́NQA GÍGNHTAI, OU̓́NOMA MÈN OU̓K I̓́SXEI TÓDE PÁQOS E̓́KDHLON, A̔́PANTI DÈ R̔HÍ̈DION QEHSAMÉNWͅ GIGNẂSKEIN .

PNÌC DÈ E̓P’ AU̓TÉOISI PA͂SI, KAÌ H̔́KISTA R̔HÏDÍWS KATAPÍNOUS I. BH̀C E̓PÌ PA͂SI MÈN, MÁLISTA DÈ E̓PÌ TOI͂SI I̔MANTÍOISI , KAÌ E̓PÌ TOI͂S KRASPÉDOISI. GARGALISMÒS GÀR TH͂S A̓RTHRÍHS A̓PÒ TW͂N U̔MÉNWN GÍGNETAI· E̓́SQ’ O̔́PH DÈ KAÌ E̓NSTÁZEI TI TOU͂ U̔GROU͂ LÁQRH E̓S TH̀N A̓RTHRÍHN O̔́QEN A̓NABH́SSOUSI· E̓PÌ DÈ TH͂ͅ STAFULH͂ͅ KAÌ TW͂ͅ KÍONI DÚSPNOIA E̓PÌ MA͂LLON, KAÌ KÁRTA PONHRH̀ KATÁPOSIS. KAÌ GÀR E̓S TÀS R̔I͂NAS E̓PÌ TW͂NDE TÒ U̔GRÒN A̓NAQLÍBETAI, SUMPAQÍHͅ TW͂N PARISQMÍWN. GHRAIOI͂SI O̔ KÍWN SUNH́QHS, STAFULH̀ DÈ NÉOISI KAÌ A̓KMÁZOUSI· POLÚAIMOI GÀR KAÌ E̓PIFLEGMAÍNEI MA͂LLON. H̔BÁSKOUSI DÈ KAÌ PAISÌ TÀ U̔MENẂDEA. TÁMNEIN DÈ PÁNTA A̓SINÉA· E̓PÌ DÈ TH͂ͅ STAFULH͂ͅ E̓́TI E̓RUQRIẂSHͅ, AI̔MORRAGÍH KAÌ PÓNOI KAÌ FLEGMON H͂S E̓PÍDOSIS.
p.note: Hippocrates, Aphor. iii. 6. We are indebted to Ermerins for changing E̓RUQRIW͂SI into E̓RUQRIẂSHͅ.

head.foreign: KEF. Q’. PERÌ TW͂N KATÀ TÀ PARÍSQMIA E̔LKW͂N.

p.foreign: ELKEA E̓N TOI͂SI PARISQMÍOISI GÍGNETAI , TÀ MÈN CUNH́QEA, EU̓H́QEA KAÌ A̓SINÉA, TÀ DÈ CENÀ, LOIMẂDEA KAÌ KTEÍNONTA. EU̓H́QEA MÈN O̔KOI͂A KAQARÁ E̓STI KAÌ SMIKRÀ KAÌ A̓BAQH͂, OU̓DÈ E̓PIFLEGMAÍNEI, KAÌ A̓NẂDUNA · LOIMẂDEA DÈ O̔KÓSA PLATÉA, KOI͂LA, R̔UPARÀ, E̓PIPÁGWͅ LEUKW͂ͅ, H̓̀ PELIDNW͂ͅ, H̓̀ MÉLANI SUNEXÓMENA · A̓́FQAI TOU̓́NOMA TOI͂SI E̔́LKESI. H̓̀N DÈ KAÌ O̔ E̓PÍPAGOS I̓́SXHͅ BÁQOS, E̓SXÁRH TÒ PÁQOS KAÌ E̓́STI KAÌ KALÉETAI· E̓N KÚKLWͅ DÈ TH͂S E̓SXÁRHS E̓RÚQHMA GÍGNETAI KARTERÒN KAÌ FLEGMONH̀ KAÌ PÓNOS FLEBW͂N, W̔S E̓P’ A̓́NQRAKOS, KAÌ MIKRÀ DÈ E̓CANQH́MATA A̓RAIÀ GIGNÓMENA, E̓́PEITA PROSEPIGIGNÓMENA SUNH́FQH TE A̓̀N KAÌ PLATÙ E̔́LKOS E̓GÉNETO. KH̓̀N MÈN E̓́CW E̓S TÒ STÓMA NÉMHTAI, E̓PÌ TH̀N KIONÍDA H̔͂KÉ TE MH̀N, KAÌ TH̀N A̓PÉTAMEN, KAÌ E̓S TH̀N GLW͂SSAN E̓SKEDÁSQH, KAÌ E̓S OU̓͂LA, KAÌ E̓S XALINOÚS· KAÌ O̓DÓNTES E̓KINH́QHSAN KAÌ E̓MELÁNQHSAN· KAÌ E̓S TÒN TRÁXHLON H̔ FLEGMONH̀ E̓CẂKEILE. KAÌ OI̔́DE MÈN OU̓ POLUH́MEROI QNH́SKOUSI FLEGMONH͂ͅ KAÌ PURETOI͂SI, KAKWDÍHͅ KAÌ A̓POSITÍHͅ. H̓̀N DÈ E̓S TÒN QẂRHKA NÉMHTAI DIÀ TH͂S A̓RTHRÍHS, KAÌ AU̓TH͂MAR A̓PÉPNICE. PNEÚMWN GÀR KAÌ KARDÍH, OU̓́TE O̓DMH͂S TOIH͂SDE, OU̓́TE E̔LKÉWN, OU̓́TE I̓XẂRWN A̓NÉXONTAI, A̓LLÀ BH͂XES KAÌ DÚSPNOIAI GÍGNONTAI.

EI̓ DÈ KAÌ TOI͂SI E̓́NDON TI SUMBAÍH PÁQOS, KOILÍHͅ, KAÌ STOMÁXWͅ, KAÌ QẂRHKI, E̓S TÒN I̓SQMÒN KAÌ TÀ PARÍSQMIA KAÌ TÀ TH͂ͅDE XWRÍA TOU͂ KAKOU͂ H̔ A̓NAFORH̀ KAÌ A̓PEREÚCIES. DIÀ TÓDE PAIDÍA MÁLISTA PÁSXEI A̓́XRIS H̔́BHS· MÁLISTA GÀR PAIDÍA KAÌ MÉGA KAÌ YUXRÒN A̓NAPNÉEI · PLEI͂STON GÀR TÒ QERMÒN E̓N TOUTÉOISI·

A̓KRATÉA DÈ KAÌ E̓DWDH͂S, KAÌ POIKÍLWN E̓PIQUMÍA, KAÌ YUXROPOSÍH · KAÌ BOH͂SAI MÉGA KAÌ E̓N O̓RGH͂ͅ KAÌ E̓N PAIDIH͂ͅ. KAÌ KOÚRHͅSI DÈ MÉXRI KAQÁRSIOS E̓PIMHNÍWN TÁDE CUNH́QEA. XẂRH DÈ TÍKTEI AI̓́GUPTOS MÁLISTA, KAÌ GÀR E̓S A̓NAPNOH̀N A̓H̀R CHRH̀ KAÌ H̔ E̓DWDH̀ POIKÍLH.
p.note: The common reading is E̓́Hͅ instead of A̓H̀R; E̓S instead of H̔; and E̓DWDH̀N instead of E̓DWDH́. Ermerins merely changes the E̓́Hͅ into H̔́DE. I trust every candid and learned reader will admit, that I have greatly improved the meaning by the slight changes which I have ventured to make. From the translation of Crassus, it may be inferred that he had read A̓H̀R, or at least had seen the necessity of introducing it into the text: "Aer enim spirando siccus adducitur." I need scarcely add, that in the old Ionic, which our author affects, A̓H̀R is often put in the feminine gender. This was also the case in old Latin. See A. Gellius, xiii. 19.
p.foreign: R̔ÍZAI GÀR KAÌ BOTÁNAI KAÌ LÁXANA POLLÀ KAÌ SPÉRMATA DRIMÉA, KAÌ POTÒN PAXÙ, U̔́DWR MÈN O̔ NEI͂LOS, DRIMÙ DÈ TÒ A̓PÒ TW͂N KRIQÉWN TÒ TW͂N BRUTÉWN PÓMA.
p.note: Ermerins suppresses the words A̓PÒ TW͂N KRIQÉWN; but this seems an unwarrantable liberty. By a small alteration I have made, the text becomes sufficiently amended. On the ancient Zythi, see Appendix to the Edinburgh Greek Lexicon.
p.foreign: TÍKTEI DÈ KAÌ H̔ SURÍH, MÁLISTA KOÍLH· O̔́QEN AI̓GÚPTIA KAÌ SURIAKÀ E̔́LKEA TÁDE KIKLH́SKOUSI.

KAÌ H̓̀N MÈN KATAKÉWNTAI, A̓NAKAQÍZOUSI, A̓NAKEKLÍSQAI OU̓K A̓NEXÓMENOI · H̓̀N DÈ A̓NAKAQÍSWSI, U̔PÒ A̓PORÍHS AU̓͂QIS A̓NAKLÍNONTAI . TÁ POLLÀ DÈ O̓RQOSTÁDHN PERIÍ̈ASI · A̓KRASÍHͅ GÀR H̔SUXÍHS TH̀N H̓REMÍHN FEÚGOUSI, PÓNWͅ PÓNON LU͂SAI QÉLONTES. A̓NAPNOH̀ EI̓́SW MEGÁLH· YUXRÒN GÀR H̓ÉRA POQÉOUSI E̓S E̓́MYUCIN · E̓́CW DÈ SMIKRH́.

A̓́PONOS GÀR H̔ FÚSIS AU̓TÉOU· MANÒS MÈN GÀR TH̀N OU̓SÍHN, EI̓RÍOISIN I̓́KELOS. H̓̀N DÈ KAÍ TIS TW͂N A̓MF’ AU̓TÒN U̔MÉNWN E̓PIFLEGMH́NHͅ, OI̔͂SI PRÒS TÒN QẂRHKA PROSÉRXETAI, CÚNESTI KAÌ PÓNOS, A̓NAPNOH̀ KAKH̀, QERMH̀, A̓NAKAQÍGNUSQAI E̓QÉLOUSI SXH͂MA O̓́RQION E̓S A̓NAPNOH́N. TÓDE GÀR R̔H́ÏSTON TW͂N SXHMÁTWN. E̓RUQROÌ TÀ PRÓSWPA· E̓PÌ DÈ MA͂LLON TÀ MH͂LA· TÀ LEUKÀ TW͂N O̓FQALMW͂N LAMURẂTATA KAÌ PÍONA. HN DÉ KOTE E̓PANAFÉRHͅ H̔ NOU͂SOS, KAÍ TI E̓S A̓GAQÒN TRÉPHTAI, AI̔MORRAGÍH LÁBRWS E̓K R̔INW͂N, KOILÍHS E̓KTÁRACIS POLLW͂N XOLWDÉWN, E̓PÁFRWN , OI̔͂A DOKÉEIN A̓PÒ PNEÚMONOS EI̓S TH̀N NEIAIRH̀N GASTÉRA E̓CEW͂SQAI, H̓̀N A̓GÁGHͅ POLLÒN U̔GRÓTERON R̔HÏDÍWS. E̓́STI DÈ O̔́TE KAÌ E̓S OU̓͂RA E̓TRÁPETO. O̔KÓSOISI DÈ PÁNTA O̔MOU͂ CUMPÍPTEI, OI̔́DE O̓CÚTATOI R̔HÍ̈ZOUSI.
METECETÉROISI DÈ PU͂ON POLLÒN GÍGNETAI E̓N PNEÚMONI, H̓̀

METÁSTASIS A̓PÒ TOU͂ PLEURÉOU, H̓̀N MÉZON TÒ A̓GAQÒN U̔POGÍGNHTAI. KH̓̀N MÈN E̓S E̓́NTERON H̓̀ KÚSTIN TÒ A̓PÒ TH͂S PLEURH͂S PARWXETEÚQHͅ PU͂ON, E̓S MÈN TÒ PARAUTÍKA E̓RH́ÏSAN A̓PÒ TH͂S PERIPNEUMONÍHS· E̔́LKOS DÈ MAKROXRÓNION I̓́SXOUSIN E̓N PLEURH͂ͅ, A̓LLÀ PERIGÍGNONTAI. O̔KÓSOI DÈ DIADIDRÁSKOUSI TH̀N E̓K TH͂S A̓PORRH́CEWS PNÍGA, E̔́LKOS OI̔́DE POLLÒN I̓́SXOUSI E̓N PNEÚMONI, KAÌ E̓S FQÓHN MEQÍSTANTAI· KAÌ A̓PÒ MÈN TH͂S A̓POSTÁSIOS KAÌ TH͂S FQÓHS GÉRONTES OU̓ PÁNU TOI PERIGÍGNON TAI· A̓PÒ DÈ TH͂S PERIPNEUMONÍHS NÉOI KAÌ A̓KMÁZONTES.

OI̔ DÈ TRÓPOI TREI͂S E̓́ASI· H̓̀ GÀR A̓PÒ R̔H́CIOS A̓GGEÍOU, H̓̀ DIABRẂSIOS , H̓̀ A̓RAIẂSIOS A̓NÁGETAI. R̔H́GNUTAI MÈN OU̓͂N E̓CAPINAÍWS, H̓̀ PLHGH͂ͅ, H̓̀ E̓NTÁSI A̓́XQEOS, H̓̀ A̓NWQH́SEI,
p.note: The common reading is A̓NAQÉSEI. Ermerins reads H̓̀ E̓NTÁSI A̓́XQEOS A̓NAQÉSEI, a very equivocal emendation. My conjectural reading, I feel confident, will be admitted to be the true one by any impartial critic.

SHMANTÉ OI DÈ KAÌ OI̔ TÓPOI, A̓F’ W̔͂NPER A̓NÁGETAI . CUNÀ GÀR POLLÀ SHMEI͂A, KAÌ H̔ A̓PÁTH R̔HÏDÍH, KAÌ I̓HTRÍH E̔TÉRH. A̓PÒ STOMÁXOU MÈN OU̓͂N OU̓́TE LÍHN E̓C A̓RAIẂSIOS A̓NÁGETAI· H̔ GÀR TW͂N BRWMÁTWN TE KAÌ TW͂N POMÁTWN YÚCIS TE KAÌ STÚYIS

E̓S PÚKNWSIN A̓́GEI TÀ MÉREA· A̓TÀR OU̓DÈ DIABRẂSIES CUNEXÉES EI̓SÌ, KAÍ TOI MA͂LLON TH͂S PROTÉRHS · TÀ GÀR A̓NADÁKNONTA TW͂N R̔EUMÁTWN OU̓ PROSÍSXETAI POLLÒN XRÓNON, A̓LL’ H̓́ A̓PEPTÚSQH , H̓̀ DIHLÁQH KÁTW. OU̓K A̓POGIGNẂSKOUSI E̔WUTW͂N OI̔ A̓́NQRWPOI, KH̓̀N E̓N TW͂ͅ E̓SXÁTWͅ E̓́WSI. DOKÉW DÈ E̓́GWGE TH̀N TOU͂ PNEÚMONOS A̓PONÍHN AI̓TÍHN E̓́MMENAI · PÓNOS GÀR KH̓̀N SMIKRÒS E̓́Hͅ, QÁNATON O̓RRWDÉEI· KAÌ E̓́STI E̓N TOI͂SI PLEÍSTOISI FOBERẂTEROS H̓̀ KAKÍWN· A̓PONÍH DÈ KAÌ E̓N TOI͂SI MEGÁLOISI KAKOI͂SI, A̓FOBÍH QANÁTOU, KAÌ E̓́STI KAKÍWN H̓̀ FOBERWTÉRH.
EU̓͂ GE O̔́LWS O̔ I̓HTRÒS, H̓DÈ O̔ DHMÓTHS, EU̓͂ GE E̓PIKLH́SIOS TOU͂DE TOU͂ PÁQEOS. W̓KUTÁTOU KAKOU͂ E̓STI OU̓́NOMA·
p.note: The reading in all the MSS. is, W̓̀ KÚFWN OU̔͂--words which evidently have no meaning. Ermerins accordingly erases them, with the three following--KAKOU͂ E̓STI OU̓́NOMA-- altogether. This, I think, will generally be admitted to be too bold a procedure. The emendation suggested by Fabricius and Mattaire, and adopted by Wigan (namely, W̓KUFÓNOU̓, is so plausible, and requires so little change of the characters, that I should have had no hesitation in adopting it, provided there were any authority for it; but this, I fear, is not the case. I have therefore ventured to substitute W̓KUTÁTOU in place of it; and I am persuaded that, upon mature consideration, it will be approved of by every competent judge. I need scarcely remark, that it is of common occurrence in the works of the medical authorities, and that it is very applicable in this place.
p.foreign: TÍ MÈN GÀR MÉZON H̓̀ W̓KÚTERO N SUGKOPH͂S DUNÁMIOS; TÍ DÈ OU̓́NOMA E̔́TERON EI̓S E̓PÍKLHSIN TOU͂DE TOU͂ PRÁGMATOS MA͂LLON EU̓́SHMON; TÍ DÈ KARDÍHS A̓́LLO KAIRIẂTERON E̓S ZWH̀N H̓̀ E̓S QÁNATON; OU̓DÈ TH̀N SUGKOPH̀N A̓́PISTON TH͂S KARDÍHS NOU͂SON E̓́MMENAI, H̓̀ AU̓TH̀N SÍNOS TH͂S E̓N AU̓TÉHͅ TOU͂ ZH͂N DUNÁMIOS· TÓSON TE TÁXOS TOU͂ O̓LÉQROU, TOIH́DE KAÌ I̓DÉH. E̓́STI GÀR TÒ PÁQOS LÚSIS TW͂N DESMW͂N TH͂S EI̓S ZWH̀N DUNÁMIOS, A̓NTÍCOUN TH͂ͅ SUSTÁSEI TOU͂ A̓NQRẂPOU E̓ÓN. TH͂SDE GÀR A̓PRÌC LABÓMEN ON OU̓ MEQÍHSI, A̓LL’ E̓S DIÁLUSIN TRÉPEI. KAÌ OU̓ MÉGA TÒ QẂÜMA. KAÌ GÀR KAÌ E̔́TERA PÁQEA I̓́DIA KAÌ E̓PÍKAIRÁTINWN MERÉWN E̓STÌ, OI̔͂SÍPER E̓MFÚNEI, KAÌ TOUTÉWN E̓CÁPTETAI· BOUBW͂NES MÈN OI̔
LOIMẂDEES KAÌ SFÓDRA KAKOH́QEES E̓C H̔́PATOS
p.note: I must own, that I feel somewhat disposed to follow the suggestion of Wigan, and read H̔́BHS: for it is well known that pestilential buboes occur principally in the groin (i. e. near the pubes), as is first noticed by Procopius (de Bello Persico, 22, 23). I am not aware, moreover, that any of the ancient authorities refer the pestilential buboes to the liver, but to the glands of the groin. See Agathias, Hist. v. and the other authorities quoted at P. ÆGINET. t. i. p. 232, Syd. Soc. Edit.

AI̔ GÀR TW͂N PRHGMÁTWN E̓S TÒ E̓́SXATON E̓PITÁSIES EI̓S TH̀N E̓NANTÍHN METABÁLLOUSI I̓DÉHN. p.note: Ermerins transposes all this clause, E̓CH́RANTAI. ..... STÓMAXOS, to the beginning of the chapter, after DÉRMATOS. I find difficulty in reconciling myself to this change; indeed, in either place, the meaning of these words is not clear.

div3.p: YUXH͂S KATÁSTASIS ,There has been much difference of opinion respecting these two words. I regard the construction as an Attic anacoluthon, of which many examples occur in our author's works, and in those of Ælian and Arrian, who were about his age. Ermerins mentions that Kün was disposed to regard them as belonging to the Glossema. This, I know, was suggested to him by the late Dr. Kerr, of Aberdeen, whose correspondence with Kün I saw at the time it took place, about thirty years ago. AI̓́SQHSIS SÚMPASA KAQARH̀, DIÁNOIA LEPTH̀, GNẂMH MANTIKH́. PROGIGNẂSKOUSI MÈN OU̓͂N PRẂTISTA MÈN W̔UTÉOISI TOU͂ BÍOU TH̀N METALLAGH́N · E̓́PEITA TOI͂SI PAREOU͂SI PROLÉGOUSI TÀ AU̓͂QIS E̓SÓMENA · OI̔ DÈ AU̓TÉOUS MÈN E̓́SQ’ O̔́TE KAÌ A̓LLOFÁSSEIN This conjectural emendation of Petit, which is adopted by Ermerins and Wigan, is an ingenious substitute for the common reading, A̓́LLO FASÌ, which evidently has no meaning. A still more simple emendation, however, would be, A̓́LLO FÁSQAI-- that is to say, the spectators "fancy that they speak strange, i. e. incoherent." See Liddel and Scott's Lexicon under A̓́LLOS, for this meaning of the word. DOKÉOUSI· TH͂ͅ A̓POBÁSI DÈ TW͂N EI̓RHMÉNWN QWÜMÁZOUSI W̔́NQRWPOI. METECÉTEROI DÈ KAÌ PROSLALÉOUSI TW͂N KATOIXOMÉNWN TISÌ, TÁXA MÈN PAREÓNTAS O̔REU͂NTES AU̓TOÌ MOU͂NOI, U̔PÒ LEPTH͂S KAÌ KAQARH͂S AI̓SQH́SIOS, TÁXA D’ AU̓TW͂N TH͂S YUXH͂S PROGGINWSKOÚSHS, KAÌ DIHGEUMÉNHS TOÙS A̓́NDRAS OI̔͂SI CUNÉSONTAI . PRÓSQEN MÈN GÀR E̓N TOI͂SI U̔GROI͂SI

p.foreign: W̔S E̓N I̓LÚÏ E̓́NHN KAÌ ZÓFWͅ.
p.note: Ermerins does not hesitate to expunge the word U̔GROI͂SIN altogether; but this seems to me an unwarrantable liberty. By the addition of one short word, W̔S, and a little transposition, I flatter myself that I have greatly improved the text. Petit proposes to read I̓LUẂDESI U̔GROI͂SI, but without referring to any medical authority for such an expression. In illustration of the general meaning of this sentence, see an important passage on the Pneuma, below. Therap. I. i.

p.note: Ermerins reads A̓KMAÍH. But the common reading is quite in accordance with the usage of our author, and is retained by Ermerins himself in chap. x. of this book, near the end. It is, in short, an Attic anacoluthon, very common in the works of that age, such as those of Ælian and Arrian.

H̔ DÈ E̔TÉRH, TÒN KÁTW LOBÒN TÒN PÉMPTON DIAPERH́NASA MÉXRI TW͂N KURTW͂N, E̓PÌ TH̀N R̔ÁXIN E̓́CEISI, KAÌ TH͂ͅDE PARATÉTATAI MÉXRI TW͂N I̓SXÍWN. A̓TÀR KAÌ H̔́DE KOÍLH. OU̓́NOMA TÒ AU̓TÒ, OU̔́NEKEN MÍA KAÌ W̔UTH́ E̓STIN H̔ FLÈY TH̀N A̓RXH̀N A̓PÒ TOU͂ H̔́PATOS I̓́SXOUSA. EI̓ GÁR TIS E̓QÉLOI, DIELÁSAI A̓̀N E̓́LASMA KAÌ A̓PÒ TH͂S A̓́NWQEN TH͂S E̓PÌ TH̀N KARDÍHN KOÍLHS FLEBÒS E̓S TH̀N
PARÀ TH̀N R̔ÁXIN, KAÌ A̓PÒ TH͂S R̔ÁXEOS DIÀ TOU͂ H̔́PATOS E̓PÌ TH̀N KARDÍHN. A̓́NODOS GÀR H̔ AU̓TH́.

HDE OU̓͂N H̔ FLÈY, W̔S E̓GẀ DOKÉW, H̔ CÚMPASA NOSÉEI O̓CÉSI PÁQESI, KARTEROI͂SI · MÍA GÁR E̓STI PA͂SA· METECETÉROISI DÈ I̓HTROI͂SI MOÚNH DOKÉEI PARÀ TH̀N R̔ÁXIN NOSÉEIN, OU̔́NEKA TH͂S E̓S TH̀N KARDÍHN TÀ SHMEI͂A OU̓ PROFANÉA. E̓NTÒS GÀR TOU͂ QẂRHKOS DIATÉTA TAI PRÒS OU̓DÈN PROSISXO MÉNH, A̓LL’ E̓NAIWREUMÉNH TW͂ͅ QẂRHKI, E̓́S T’ A̓̀N A̓PÒ TOU͂ DIAFRÁGMATOS E̓MFÚHͅ TH͂ͅ KARDÍHͅ. H̓̀N OU̓͂N TI MEGÁLWN KAKW͂N I̓́SXHͅ TH́NDE TH̀N FLÉBA, CUNÉKRUYE A̓MPÉXWN O̔ QẂRHC.

CUMPAQH̀S GÀR KAÌ H̔́DE GÍGNETAI PAR’ AU̓TÉHN E̓P’ A̓RISTERÀ KEIMÉNH, W̔S TH͂S E̓PÌ TW͂ͅ PANTÌ
DIAPNOH͂S
p.note: This word is supplied by Ermerins on his own conjecture. Certainly some such term seems to be wanting in this place.

EU̓͂TE O̔KÓSOI TH́NDE TH̀N KATÁSTASIN EI̓͂DON, KAU͂SON E̓KÁLEON.
p.note: Ermerins reads KAÚSOU I̓DÉHN, which, no doubt, makes very good sense; but the common reading appears quite satisfactory. It is but justice to Ermerins to add, that he improves the next clause of the sentence very much by a change in the punctuation.

KH̓̀N MÈN H̔ GASTH̀R H̓̀ H̔ KÚSTIS TÒ POTÒN U̔POFÉRHͅ, OU̓DÈ E̓MÉTOU DEI͂· EI̓ DÈ MH̀, E̓PÌ POLLW͂ͅ TW͂ͅ YUXRW͂ͅ TÒ POLLÒN E̓MÉSAI XRH́. E̓KRAGEÍH GÀR A̓̀N W̔́NQRWPOS, EI̓ TOSÓNDE PÍNWN MHDÈN DIAXWROÍH, H̓̀ I̔DRW͂SI, H̓̀ OU̓́ROISI, H̓̀ KOILÍHͅ.

head.foreign: KEF. Q’. PERÌ TW͂N KATÀ TOÙS NEFROÙS O̓CÉWN PAQW͂N.

div3.p: NEFROÌ, TH̀N MÈN TOU͂ SẂMATOS I̓DÉHN, OU̓ KÁRTA E̓PÍKAIROI E̓S KÍNDUNON, H̓̀N KAÍ TI PÁQWSI O̓CÉWS. A̓DENẂDEES GÀR TH̀N FÚSIN, E̓S DÈ O̓́LEQRON EU̓H́QEES·It appears to me that all the translators have misunderstood the meaning of these words, E̓S DÈ O̓́LEQRON EU̓H́QEES, which Henisch and Boerhaave translate, "ad mortem vero inferendam ben・habiles sunt:" Wigan and Ermerins,--"ægrum tamen facile interimunt." Moffat rather oddly,--"well calculated for bearing an attack." Now the literal meaning of the words obviously is, "they are innocent as regards death;" which surely can imply nothing but that the affections of the kidneys are not naturally deadly. (See Liddel and Scott's Lexicon under the word.) In fact, whoever will read the context carefully must see that this meaning is the only one in accordance with it, and with what is said below, namely, that the majority of cases are not fatal. Ermerins, in this instance, vitiates the text by meddling with it, and substituting GÀR for DÈ after E̓PÍKAIRON. E̓PÍKAIRON DÈ AU̓TÉWN TÒ E̓́RGON, H̔́ TE DIÁKRISIS TW͂N OU̓́RWN A̓PÒ TOU͂ AI̔́MATOS KAÌ H̔ A̓PÓKRISIS.

p.foreign: EPÉXEI DÈ TH́NDE H̓̀ LÍQOS, H̓̀ E̓GGIGNOMÉNH FLEGMONH̀, H̓̀ AI̔MÁLWY, H̓́ TI TOIÓNDE · EU̓͂TE E̓K CUMPAQÍHS MÈN TH͂S DIÀ TH̀N I̓DÉHN TOU͂ SẂMATOS KAKÒN GÍGNETAI OU̓DÈN, H̔ DÈ E̓PÍSXESIS TW͂N OU̓́RWN PÁNTA TÀ DEINÀ PRH́SSEI.
p.note: Here, again, nearly all the translators and editors have misunderstood the meaning of the passage from not perceiving that SẂMATOS is here applied not to the whole body, but to the organ or part of the body of which the author is treating, namely, the kidneys. It would be superfluous to multiply references to passages in which Aretæus applies SW͂MA to a particular part of the body. See Morb. Diut. i. 10; Curat. Morb. Diut. i. 13; also Galen, De Locis Affectis, i.9. Indeed Aristotle applies it expressly to the kidneys, in the sense of the fleshy part of the organ, or viscus, H. A. i. 17, 15. The meaning of the passage in question, therefore, evidently is, that "no mischief from sympathy arises in this case, owing to the peculiar nature of the affected viscus itself, but the retention of the urine produces most horrible mischief." Wigan translates the passage thus, -- "reliqui corporis species, nullo affectus ex consensu, perturbatur." Boerhaave thus:--"quandoquidem ex consensu affectionis ob formam corporis provenientis nulla creatur offensio;" and Ermerins thus: "quo facto nullum quidem malum oritur propter cæterarum partium cum renis subitantia consensum." Of these translations that of Ermerins approaches nearest to the true import of the passage. The other two have no distinct meaning.
p.foreign: PU͂R MÈN GÀR DRIMÙ, A̓SW͂DES,

div3.p: O̓DÚNH KAT’ O̓SFÙN E̓PÌ R̔ÁXI BAREI͂A, DIÁTASIS TW͂N MERW͂N, MA͂LLON DÈ TW͂N A̓MFÌ TÒ U̔POXÓNDRION· OU̓́ROU E̓PÍSXESIS, OU̓K E̓S TÒ PÁMPAN, A̓LLÀ STÁGDHN MÈN OU̓RÉOUSI, E̓PIQUMÍH DÈ POLLÒN E̓KXÉAI· PLHMMÚRHS GÀR AI̓́SQHSIS. H̓̀N DÈ KAÌ TÒ OU̓͂RON DRIMÙ KAÌ DAKNW͂DES E̓GGÉNHTAI, YÚCIES, TRÓMOI, SPASMOÌ , DIATÁSIES KAÌ PLHRẂSIES TW͂N U̔POXONDRÍWN· I̓KÉLH H̔ CUMFORH̀ H̔́DE KAÌ CUNAÍSQHSIS GÍGNETAI TOI͂SI A̓PÒ PLH́QEOS SITÍWN KAÌ DIAFQORH͂S E̓MFUSHQEI͂SI TH̀N KOILÍHN · SFUGMOÌ TÀ PRW͂TA MÈN A̓RAIOÌ, NWQROÍ · H̓̀N DÈ E̓PÌ MA͂LLON TÒ KAKÒN PIÉZHͅ, SMIKROÌ, PUKNOÌ, TARAXẂDEES , A̓́TAKTOI, U̔́PNOI LEPTOÌ, O̓DUNẂDEES, OU̓ DIHNEKÉES, KAÌ E̓CAPÍNHS E̓KQORNÚMENOI W̔S U̔PÒ NÚCIOS, EI̓͂TA U̔POFÉRONTAI E̓S KW͂MA, W̔S U̔PÒ KAMÁTOU · TH̀N GNẂMHN OU̓ KÁRTA PARÁFOROI, LHRẂDEES, PELIDNOÌ TÀ PRÓSWPA· H̓̀N DÈ H̔́KHͅ AU̓͂QÍS KOTE TH͂S OU̓RH́SIOS H̔ PROQUMÍH, E̓PÌ SPASMOI͂SI KAÌ MEGÁLHͅSI O̓DÚNHͅSI BRAXÙ A̓̀N KAÌ STÁGDHN E̓CÉKRINE, EU̓͂TE SMIKRÒN E̓PANH͂KE TW͂N PÓNWN· EI̓͂TA E̓S TÀ AU̓TÀ PALINDROMÉES· O̓CÚTATA DÈ QNH́SKOUSI TW͂NDE OI̔͂SIN OU̓DÈN E̓KKRÍNEI, O̔KÓSOI DH̀ QNH́SKOUSI· OI̔ PLEU͂NES GÀR PERIGÍGNONTAI, H̓̀ TOU͂ LÍQOU E̓S TH̀N KÚSTIN DIÀ TW͂N OU̓́RWN E̓KPESÓNTOS, H̓̀ TH͂S FLEGMONH͂S E̓S PU͂ON TREPOMÉNHS, H̓̀ KATÀ BRAXÙ DIAPNEOMÉNHS. H̓̀N GÀR KAÌ E̓PÌ SMIKRÒN E̓NDEW͂S DIECÍHͅ TÒ OU̓͂RON R̔HÏDÍWS DIADIDRH́SKOUSI TÒN O̓́LEQRON·The text in all the MSS. is evidently vitiated. I have adopted the emendations partly of Wigan and partly of Ermerins. The reforms of the latter are sometimes too radical for my conservative judgment. XRÓNWͅ DÈ MAKRW͂ͅ FQÍNOUSI TH̀N E̔́CIN. O̓RQW͂S TÁDE OI̔ NOSÉONTES PÁSXOUSI, KAÌ KATAGÍGNONTAI E̓S SÚNTHCIN U̔POFERÓMENOI.

ECERRÁGH KOTÈ AI̔͂MA A̓PÒ TW͂N NEFRW͂N POLLÒN A̓QRÓON, KAÌ POLLH͂ͅSI H̔MÉRHͅSI CUNEXÈS E̓́RREE· A̓LL’ OU̓́ TINES AI̔MORRAGÍHͅ QNH́SKOU SI, A̓LLÀ TH͂ͅ FLEGMONH͂ͅ TH͂ͅ CÙN AI̔MORRAGÍHͅ GIGNOMÉNHͅ, H̓̀N E̓PISXEQH͂ͅ TÒ AI̔͂MA· TÀ POLLÀ DÈ E̓C E̓PISXÉSIOS E̓PÌ MEGÁLHͅ FLEGMONH͂ͅ QNH́SKOUSI.

p.foreign: KÚSTIS XALEPH̀ MÈN E̓N NOÚSOISI O̓CÉHͅSI PONH͂SAI· KH̓̀N A̓́LLOISI CUMPEPÓNQHͅ· XALEPWTÉRH DÈ KAÌ QANATWDESTÉRH, H̓̀N A̓F’ E̔WUTH͂S A̓́RCHTAI. KAÌ GÀR KAÌ DUNATWTÁTH PÁNTA CUMPAQÉA POIH͂SAI, KAÌ NEU͂RA, KAÌ GNẂMHN. NEU͂RON GÀR H̔ KÚSTIS YUXRÒN KAÌ LEUKÒN, A̓TÀR KAÌ PORRWTÁTW TOU͂ OI̓KEÍOU QÁLPEOS· E̓GGUTÁTW DÈ TH͂S E̓́CW YÚCIOS. E̓N GÀR TH͂ͅ NEIAIRH͂ͅ GASTRÌ KATWTÁTW I̔́ZEI PROSWTÁTW TOU͂ QẂRHKOS · A̓LLÀ KAÌ E̓́RGON AU̓TÉHS E̓PÍKAIRON H̔ TW͂N OU̓́RWN E̓́CODOS.

div3.p: KH̓̀N OU̓͂N MOU͂NON H̔́DE E̓PISXEQH͂ͅ LÍQOISI, H̓̀ QRÓMBOISI, H̓́ TEWͅ A̓́LLHͅ I̓DÍHͅ, H̓̀ A̓LLOTRÍHͅ CUMFORH͂ͅ, QANATW͂DES. E̓PÌ GUNAIKW͂N MÈN GÀR AU̓TÉWN KAÌ U̔STÉRWN FLEGMONH̀ A̓NAPIÉZEI, In all the MSS. the common reading is FLEGMONÀS, from which no suitable meaning can be elicited. Ermerins introduces many changes; thus he reads,--AU̓TÉHN KAÌ U̔STÉRH FLEGMH́NASÀ A̓̀N PIÉZEI; and, in the next clause he erases TÒ EU̓QÙ. By merely changing FLEGMONÀS into -H̀, I am persuaded that a legitimate reading is obtained. ANAPIÉZW is a Hippocratic term. Art. 807, ed. Föes. It is to be borne in mind that the FLEGMONH̀ of the ancients was a Phlegmon rather than an inflammation; i.e. it was O̓́GKOS O̓DUNHRÓS. See Föes, Œc. Hipp. E̓P’ A̓NDRW͂N DÈ, TÒ E̓́SXATON, TÒ EU̓QÙ, TÒ PARÁMHKE S E̓́NTERON. E̓N POLLOI͂SI DÈ E̓K KARTERÍHS A̓EKOUSÍOU U̔P’ AI̓DOU͂S E̓N CULLÓGOISI H̓̀ CUNDEÍPNOISI PLHROUMÉNH DIATÉTATAI , A̓DRANÍHͅ TE PERISTOLH͂S OU̓KÉTI MEQÍHSI. E̓PH̀N OU̓͂N E̓PÍSXHͅ TÀ OU̓͂RA, PLHRẂSIES KAÌ TW͂N U̔́PERQEN MERÉWN· NEFRW͂N, OU̓RHTH́RWN DIATÁSIES·

IDÉAI DÈ MURÍAI. H̔́DE H̔ PERÍODOS OU̓ KÁRTA DHQÚNEI · KAÌ TOI͂SI MÈN H̔ KEFALH̀ A̓LGÉEI PA͂SA· KAÌ H̔́DE A̓́LLOTE MÈN E̓PÌ DECIÁ· A̓́LLOTE DÈ E̓P’ A̓RISTERÁ· H̓̀ MÉTWPON, H̓̀ BRÉGMA, KAÌ TAU͂TA E̓N TH͂ͅ AU̓TH͂ͅ H̔MÉRHͅ R̔EMBẂDEA TRÓPON.

div3.p: TOI͂SI DÈ KAÌ TÀ DECIÀ MOU͂NON, H̓̀ TÀ LAIÀ MOU͂NON, E̓S O̔́SON O̔RÍZWN KRÓTAFOS, H̓̀ W̓͂S, H̓̀ KAÌ O̓FRÙS MÍA, H̓̀ O̓FQALMÒS EI̔͂S, H̓̀ R̔ÌS MÉSFI MÉSOU E̓S I̓͂SA TÉMNEI, E̓PÉKEINA DÈ TÒ A̓́LGHMA OU̓ PERH͂ͅ A̓LL’ E̓N H̔MÍSEÏ MÍMNEI TW͂ͅ TH͂S KEFALH͂S XWRÍWͅ.The changes in the text here introduced by Ermerins, are absolutely demanded by the confused state of matters as they stand in the MSS. E̔TEROKRANÍH TÓDE MOU͂NON KALÉETAI· OU̓K EU̓́HQES KAKÒN, KH̓̀N DIALEÍPHͅ, KH̓̀N SMIKRÒN E̓́MMENAI DOKÉHͅ· H̓̀N GÀR E̓MPÉSHͅ KOTÈ O̓CÉWS, AI̓SXRÀ KAÌ DEINÀ PRH́SSEI· SPASMÒS KAÌ DIASTROFH̀ TOU͂ PROSẂPOU GÍGNETAI· O̓FQALMOÌ H̓̀ A̓TENÉES KÉRASI I̓́KELOI PEPH́GASI, H̓̀ TH͂ͅDE KA̓KEI͂SE SPASMẂDE ES E̓́NDON EI̔LW͂NTAI· SKOTÓDINOS · O̓FQALMW͂N U̔POBRÚXIOS PÓNOS A̓́XRI MHNÍGGWN. I̔DRẀS A̓́SXETOS, TENÓNTWN E̓CAPÍNHS A̓́LGOS,The common reading is I̔DRẀS A̓́SXETOS TENÓNTWN E̓CAPÍNHS A̓́LOGOS, which Ermerins alters to I̔DRẀS A̓́SXETOS · TENÓNTWN PÓNOS E̓CAPÍNHS, A̓́LOGOS; but the obvious objection to this emendation is, that it does not account for the omission of PÓNOS in the common text. On my own authority, I altered the passage as above; but I find that I had been anticipated by Wigan in so far. W̔SPEREÍ TINOS PATÁCANTOS

p.foreign: CÚLWͅ· NAUTÍH, E̓́METOS XOLWDÉWN, KATÁPTWSIS TOU͂ A̓NQRẂPOU · H̓̀N D’ E̓PITEÍNHͅ KOTÈ TÒ PÁQOS, W̔́NQRWPOS E̓TELEÚTHSE . H̓̀N DÈ SMIKRÓTERONH̓͂ͅ, KAÌ E̓S O̓́LEQRONA̓SINÈS, XRONÍZEI, O̓́KNOS POULÙS, KARHBARÍH, A̓PORÍH, ZWH̀ DÚSFOROS. KAÌ GÁR PWS FEÚGOUSI TH̀N AU̓GH́N· SKÓTOS DÈ PRHÖ́NEI TOUTÉOISI TH̀N NOU͂SON· OU̓ DÈ E̓SIDEI͂N TI H̓̀ A̓KOU͂SAI TERPNÒN EU̓́FOROI · KÁKODMOI TH̀N O̓́SFRHSIN, KAÌ OU̓́TE TI EU̓W͂DES AU̓TÉOUS TÉRPEI, E̓KTRÉPONTAI DÈ KAÌ TÀ KAKẂDEA · A̓́XQONTAI TW͂ͅ BÍWͅ, QANATW͂SI W̔́NQRWPOI.
AI̓TÍH DÈ TOUTÉWN CÙN CHRÓTHTI YÚCIS· H̓̀N DÈ DHQÚNHͅ KAÌ E̓S MÉZON E̔́RPHͅ E̓PÌ TOI͂SI PÓNOISI, TÒ PÁQOS SKÓTWMA GÍGNETAI.

div3.p:
HN ZÓFOS TÀS O̓́YIAS SXH͂ͅ, KAÌ DI͂NOS A̓MFÌ TH̀N KEFALH̀N E̔LÍSSHTAI, KAÌ W̓͂TA BOMBÉHͅ O̔́KWS R̔EÓNTWN KANAXHDÒN POTAMW͂N, H̓̀ OI̔͂ON A̓́NEMOS I̔STÍOISI E̓GKUBERNH͂,
Tηις ωορδ ξαν σξαρξελψ βε τηε ριγητ ρεαδινγ; βυτ ιτ ις διφφιξυλτ το φινδ α προπερ συβστιτυτε φορ ιτ. Wερε I δισποσεδ το βολδ αττεμπτς ατ εμενδατιον, I σηουλδ προποσε το συβστιτυτε E̓MBRÉMETAI ιν πλαξε οφ ιτ; φορ, ξονσιδερινγ ηοω φονδ ουρ αυτηορ ις οφ Hομεριξ διξτιον, νοτηινγ σεεμς σο νατυραλ ας το συπποσε τηατ ηε ηαδ ιν μινδ τηε ξελεβρατεδ πασσαγε ιν τηε Iλιαδ,--
------ A̓NÉMOIO DÈ DEINÒS A̓H́THS ISTÍWͅ E̓MBRÉMETAI ̔XV. 627̓.
Wιγαν συγγεστς E̓GKURKANÉHͅ ορ E̓GKUKANÉHͅ; βυτ τηεσε ωορδς αρε ατ λεαστ ας οβjεξτιοναβλε ας τηε ονε τηεψ αρε ιντενδεδ το συππλψ α συβστιτυτε φορ. Iν τηε MS. ιν τηε Bριτιση Mυσευμ, ωε ρεαδ EU̓ERGÉINHÍ̈· ανδ τηις, περηαπς, ις τηε τρυε ρεαδινγ. H̓̀ AU̓LW͂N, H̓̀ KAÌ SURÍGGWN E̓NOPH̀, H̓̀ TRISMOU͂ A̔MÁCHS I̓AXH̀, O̓NOMÁZO MEN SKÓTWMA TÒ PÁQOS, KAKÒN MÈN, KH̓̀N SÚMPTWMA KEFALH͂S, KAKÒN DÈ, KH̓̀N E̓K DIADÉCIOS KEFALAÍHS, H̓̀ E̓C E̔WUTÉHS XRONÍOU NOÚSOU FÚHͅ. H̓̀N GÀR TÁDE MÈN MH̀ A̓POGÍGNHTAI, MÍMNHͅ DÈ H̔ SKOTODÍNH, H̓̀ XRÓNWͅ MAKRW͂ͅ TELEWQH͂ͅ TOI͂SI I̓DÍOISI SUMPTẂMASI OU̓́ TINOS A̓KEOMÉNOU, PÁQOS TÒ SKÓTWMA GÍGNETAI, E̓P’ AI̓TÍHͅ U̔GRH͂ͅ TE

p.foreign: KAÌ YUXRH͂ͅ· A̓LLÀ KAÌ A̓RXH̀ PAQÉWN A̓́LLWN, H̓̀N E̓S A̓NH́KESTON TRAPH͂ͅ, MANÍHS, MELAGXOLÍHS, E̓PILHYÍHS, PROSEPIGIGNOMÉNWN E̔KÁSTHͅ TW͂N I̓DÍWN CUMPTWMÁTWN· SKOTÁMATOS DÈ H̔ I̓DÉA, BÁROS TH͂S KEFALH͂S, O̓FQALMW͂N MARMARUGAÌ E̓PÌ POLLW͂ͅ TW͂ͅ SKOTẂDEÏ· A̓GNWSÍH E̔WUTÉWN TE KAÌ TW͂N PÉLAS· KAÌ H̓̀N E̓P’ AU̓CH́SEI H̔ NOU͂SOS GÍGNHTAI, TÁ TE GUI͂A LÚONTAI, KAÌ E̔́RPONTAI XAMAÍ· NAUTÍH KAÌ E̓́METOS FLÉGMAT OS, H̓̀ XOLWDÉWN, CANQW͂N, H̓̀ MELÁNWN. EU̓͂TE E̓PÌ MÈN CANQH͂ͅ XOLH͂ͅ, MANÍAI GÍGNONTAI· E̓PÌ DÈ TOI͂SI MÉLASI, MELAGXOLÍH · E̓PÌ DÈ TW͂ͅ FLÉGMATI, H̔ E̓PILHYÍH. PASW͂N GÀR H̔́DE NOÚSWN TROPH́.
p.note: Ermerins finds great difficulty in explaining the exact meaning of the last sentence. He does not seem to have adverted that our author had in view 75, 76, 77, 78, 79, 80, of the seventh section of the Aphorisms of Hippocrates. See the Commentary of Galen, and the English edition, Syd. Soc. Ed. t. ii. p.773. I must say, however, that TW͂NDE seems wanting in this place.

div3.p: POIKÍLON H̓DÈ A̓LLÓKOTON KAKÒN H̔ E̓PILHYÍH, QHRIW͂DES MÈN E̓N PAROCUSMOI͂SI KAÌ KÁTOCU KAÌ O̓LÉQRION. E̓́KTEINE GÁR KOTE PAROCUSMÒS EI̔͂S· H̓̀N DÈ MELÉTHͅSI FÉRHͅ W̔́NQRWPOS, ZH͂ͅ MÈN AI̓́SXEA KAÌ O̓NEÍDEA KAÌ A̓́LGEA FÉRWN, R̔HÏDÍWS DÈ OU̓K A̓́PEISI H̔ NOU͂SOS, A̓LLÀ E̓N H̔LIKÍHͅSÍ TE TH͂ͅSI KREÍTTOSI E̓NOIKÉEI KAÌ W̔́RHͅ TH͂ͅ W̔RAÍHͅ. CUNDIAITA͂TAÍ TE PAISÌ KAÌ MEIRAKÍOISI. E̓CHLÁQH DÉ KOTE U̔P’ EU̓TUXÍHS, DI’ A̓́LLHS H̔LIKÍHS MÉZONOS, EU̓͂TE TW͂ͅ KÁLLEÏ SUNÉCEISI TH͂S W̔́RHS· A̓LLÀ KAÌ TÓTE METECETÉROUS AI̓SXROÙS A̓PODEÍCASA, A̓PÓLLUSI TOÙS PAI͂DAS FQÓNWͅ TOU͂ KÁLLEOS, H̓̀ XEIRÒS A̓KRASÍHͅ, H̓̀ PROSẂPOU DIASTROFH͂ͅ, H̓̀ PHRẂSI TINÒS AI̓SQH́SIOS· Our author here has evidently in view a passage contained in the Hippocratic treatise "On the Sacred Disease." See Syd. Soc. Ed. t. ii. p. 851. I cannot see the same objection to FQÓNWͅ, the common reading, as Ermerins does, who proposes to substitute FQÓRWͅ in place of it. The other, although metaphorical, is quite in the style of our author. H̓̀N DÈ FWLEÚSHͅ TÒ KAKÒN E̓S R̔ÍZHN,

p.foreign: OU̓́TE I̓HTRW͂ͅ OU̓́TE H̔LIKÍHS METABOLAI͂S E̓S E̓́CODON PEÍQETAI, A̓LLÀ CUMBIOI͂ MÉSFI QANÁTOU. POTÌ KAÌ E̓PÍPONOS H̔ NOU͂SOS SPASMOI͂SI KAÌ DIASTROFH͂ͅSI MELÉWN TE KAÌ O̓́YIOS, E̓́TREYE DÉ KOTE KAÌ GNẂMHN E̓S MANÍHN. A̓TERPH̀S MÈN H̔ TOU͂ PAROCUSMOU͂ QÉH, AI̓SXRH̀ DÈ KAÌ H̔ A̓PÓLEIYIS AU̓TÉOU, E̓PÌ A̓FÓDWͅ KAÌ OU̓́ROISI KAÌ AU̓TOMÁTWͅ KOILÍHͅ.

ALLÀ KAÌ A̓́DOCOS H̔ CUMMORFH́· DOKÉEI GÀR TOI͂SI E̓S TH̀N SELH́NHN A̓LITROI͂SI A̓FIKNEI͂ SQAI H̔ NOU͂SOS· TOU̓́NEKEN I̔ERH̀N KIKLH́SKOUSI TH̀N PÁQHN· A̓TÀR KAÌ DI’ A̓́LLAS PROFÁSIAS, H̓̀ MÉGEQOS TOU͂ KAKOU͂· I̔ERÒN GÀR TÒ MÉGA· H̓̀ I̓H́SIOS OU̓K A̓NQRWPÍNHS, A̓LLÀ QEÍHS, H̓̀ DAÍMONOS DÓCHS E̓S TÒN A̓́NQRWPON EI̓SÓDOU, H̓̀ CUMPÁNTWN O̔MOU͂, TH́NDE E̓KÍKLHSKON I̔ERH́N.

OKÓSA MÈN OU̓͂N W̔S E̓PÌ O̓CEÍHͅ GÍGNETAI TH͂ͅ NOÚSWͅ, PRÓSQEN MOI LÉLEKTAI· H̓̀N DÈ E̓N XRÓNWͅ MÍMNHͅ, OU̓DÈ E̓PÌ TOI͂SI DIALEÍMMASI A̓SINÉES, NWQROÌ, A̓́QUMOI, KATHFÉES, E̓CÁNQRWPOI , A̓́MIKTOI, OU̓DÈ H̔LIKÍHͅSI MEILÍXIOI, A̓́GRUPNOI, DUSÓNEIROI POLLOI͂SI A̓LLOKÓTOISI, A̓PÓSITOI, PÉYAI KAKOÌ, A̓́XROOI, MOLIBDẂDEES, DUSMAQÉES NWQEÍHͅ GNẂMHS TE KAÌ AI̓SQH́SIOS, BARUH́KOOI, H̓͂XOI, BÓMBOI A̓NÀ TH̀N KEFALH́N . GLW͂SSA A̓SAFH̀S KAÌ PARÁFOROS· H̓̀ U̔PÒ TH͂S DIAQÉSIOS TH͂S NOÚSOU, H̓̀ U̔PÒ TRWMÁTWN E̓N TH͂ͅSI KATALH́YESI , SPASMẂDEES . p.foreign: TOIOÍDE GIGNONTAI OI̔ MELAGXOLẂDEES, EU̓͂T’ A̓̀N U̔PÒ TOU͂ KAKOU͂ KTEINÉWNTAI.

ESTI DÈ A̓QUMÍH E̓PÌ MIH͂ͅ FANTASÍHͅ, A̓́NEU TE PURETOU͂· DOKÉEI TE DÉ MOI MANÍHS TE E̓́MMENAI A̓RXH̀ KAÌ MÉROS H̔ MELAGXOLÍH . TOI͂SI MÈN GÀR MAINOMÉNOISI A̓́LLOTE MÈN E̓S O̓RGH̀N, A̓́LLOTE D’ E̓S QUMHDÍHN H̔ GNẂMH TRÉPETAI, TOI͂SI DÈ MELAGXOLW͂SI E̓S LÚPHN KAÌ A̓QUMÍHN MOU͂NON.
p.note: The sense evidently requires A̓QUMÍHN in place of QUMHDÍHN, the common reading. See Petit and Ermerins.
p.foreign: A̓TÀR KAÌ MAÍNONTAI MÈN E̓S TÀ PLEI͂STA TOU͂ BÍOU, A̓FRONÉONTES KAÌ DEINÀ KAÌ AI̓SXRÀ PRH́SSONTES · MELAGXOLW͂SI DÈ OU̓K E̓PÌ E̔NÌ EI̓́DEÏ E̔́KASTOI · A̓LL’ H̓̀ PRÒS FARMAKÍHN U̔́POPTOI, H̓̀ E̓S E̓RHMÍHN FEÚGOUSI MISANQRWPÍHͅ, H̓̀ E̓S DEISIDAIMONÍHN TRÉPONTAI, H̓̀ MI͂SÓS E̓STI TOU͂ ZH͂N TOUTÉOISI. H̓̀N DÈ E̓C A̓QUMÍHS A̓́LLOTE KAÌ A̓́LLOTE DIÁXUSIS GÉNHTAI, H̔DONH̀ PROSGÍGNETAI E̓PÌ TOI͂SI PLEÍSTOISI · OI̔ DÈ MAÍNONTAI.
OKWS DÈ, KAÌ A̓PÒ KOÍWN XWRÍWN TÀ POLLÀ GÍGNONTAI FRÁSW. H̓̀N MÈN E̓N TOI͂SI U̔POXONDRÍOISI MÍMNHͅ H̔ AI̓TÍH, A̓MFÌ TÀS FRÉNAS EI̔LÉETAI, KAÌ DIECÍEI XOLH̀ A̓́NWQEN, H̓̀ KÁTWQEN MELAGXO LW͂SIN·

H̓̀N DÈ KAÌ KEFALH̀N E̓S CUMPAQEÍHN A̓́GHͅ, KAÌ A̓MEÍBETAI TÒ PARÁLOGON TH͂S O̓CUQUMÍHS E̓S GÉLWTA KAÌ H̔DONH̀N E̓S TÀ POLLÀ TOU͂ BÍOU, OI̔ DÈ MAÍNONTAI AU̓́CHͅ TH͂S NOÚSOU MA͂LLON H̓̀ A̓LLAGH͂ͅ PÁQEOS.

EP’ A̓MFOI͂N DÈ CHRÓTHS AI̓TÍH. A̓́NDRES MÈN OU̓͂N MAÍNONTAI KAÌ MELAGXOLW͂SI, H̓̀ KAÌ A̓NDRW͂N E̓LÁSSOUS· KÁKION DÈ A̓NDRW͂N AI̔ GUNAI͂KES E̓KMAÍNONTAI· H̔LIKÍH, PRÒS A̓KMH̀N, KAÌ OI̔ A̓KMÁZONTES · W̔́RH QÉROS MÈN KAÌ FQINÓPWRON TÍKTEI, E̓́AR DÈ KRÍNEI.

TEKMH́RIA MÈN OU̓͂N OU̓K A̓́SHMA. H̓̀ GÀR H̔́SUXOI, H̓̀ STUGNOÌ, KATHFÉES, NWQROÌ E̓́ASI A̓LÓGWS, OU̓́ TINI E̓P’ AI̓TÍHͅ, MELAGXOLÍHS A̓RXH́. E̓́TI DÈ KAÌ O̓RGÍLOI PROSGÍGNONTAI, DÚSQUMOI, A̓́GRUPNOI, E̓K TW͂N U̔́PNWN E̓KQORUBOÚMENOI.

div3.p: EXEI DÈ AU̓TÉOUS KAÌ TÁRBOS E̓́KTOPON, H̓̀N E̓S AU̓́CHSIN TÒ NÓSHMA FOITH͂ͅ, EU̓͂TE KAÌ O̓́NEIROI A̓LHQÉES, DEIMATẂDEES, E̓NARGÉES. O̔KÓSA GÀR U̔PÀR E̓KTRÉPONTAI O̔POÍOU W̓͂N KAKOU͂, TÁDE E̓NÚPNION O̔RÉOUSI W̔́RMHSE·This passage, in all the MSS., is confessedly corrupt. I have adopted the conjectural emendation of Ermerins, although very bold, and, I must add, not quite satisfactory. PRÒS TÒ R̔HÍ̈DION METAGNW͂NAI EU̓́KOLOI, AI̓SXROÌ, SMIKROLÓGOI, A̓́DWROI, KAÌ MET’ OU̓ POLÙ A̔PLOI͂, A̓́SWTOI, POLÚDWROI, OU̓K A̓RETH͂ͅ YUXH͂S, A̓LLÀ POIKILÍHͅ NOSH́MATOS· H̓̀N DÈ E̓PÌ MA͂LLON TÒ KAKÒN PIÉZHͅ, MI͂SOS, FUGANQRWPÍH, O̓LÓFURSOI E̓S KENEÀ, ZWH͂S KAKH́GOROI· E̓́RANTAI DÈ QANÁTOU. p.note: I flatter myself that every person who is familiar with the metaphysics of the ancients, will admit that I have improved this sentence by changing H̔́DE into H̓DÉ. Ermerins, not recognising the difference between the GNẂMH and the NOU͂S, expunges TOU͂ NOU͂ from the text. On the distinction between these portions or powers of the mind, see Aristotle de Anima, iii. 10, etc.; Metaphysica, pluries.

div3.p: EU̓MAQÉSI A̓STRONOMÍH A̓DÍDAKTOS,Though I have not meddled with the text, I am much inclined to think that the true reading would be A̓UTODÍDAKTOS. It occurs in Æschylus, Agamem. 964. By the way, the example referred to by the Oxford lexicographers, to prove that A̓DÍDAKTOS is sometimes used synonymously with AU̓TODÍDAKTOS (namely, Lucian, Hist. Conscr. 34), is not in point here. We cannot say that "astronomy" is untaught, in the same sense that we can say that "political sagacity" is so. FILOSOFÍH AU̓TOMÁTH, POÍHSIS DH͂QEN A̓PÒ MOUSÉWN. DOKÉW DÈ E̓GẂ KOTE KAÌ STÓMAXON, KAÌ TÀ E̓́NTERA, KAÌ KÚSTIN, KAÌ TÒ PARÁMHKES E̓́NTERON A̓́XRI TH͂S A̓RXH͂S TWU̓TÒ PEPONQÉNAI· A̓LLÀ TÀ MÈN MÉLEA TÀ E̓NTÒS E̓KLUÓMENA
p.note: The common reading, E̔LKÉWN NE̔UEI, having evidently no meaning, I follow Wigan and Ermerins in adopting this word. I am also indebted to the latter for various other amendments in this chapter, which I do not think it necessary to mention singly.
p.foreign: KRUPTÀ KAÌ A̓FANÉA· H̔MITELÉES DÈ KAÌ AI̔ E̓NÉRGEIAI· TH͂ͅDÉ MOI DOKÉEI KAÌ H̔MIPAQÉA E̓́MMENAI TÀ MÉREA DIXH͂ U̔PÒ TH͂S NOU͂SOU TETMHMÉNA. TÓDE MÉNTOI TÒ PRH͂GMA DÍDAGMA DIAFORH͂S DUNÁMIÓS TE KAÌ KRÍSIOS PRÒS A̓RISTERÀ DECIOI͂S. I̓́SH MÈN GÀR KAÌ H̔ PROSÍZOUSA AI̓TÍH, CUNAÌ DÈ A̓MFOI͂N TOU͂ PÁQEOS AI̔ PROFÁSIES, H̓́N TE YÚCIS, H̓́N TE A̓PEYÍH, A̓LLÀ A̓́MFW PAQEI͂N OU̓K I̓͂SA A̓́N. I̓SÓRROPOS DÈ H̔ FÚSIS, W̔S E̓N I̓SORRÓPWͅ, TWU̓TÒN DÈ E̓N A̓NÍSOIS A̓DÚNATON. H̓̀N MÈN OU̓͂N TH͂S KEFALH͂S KÁTW PÁQHͅ TIS A̓RXH̀, O̔KOI͂ÓN TI TOU͂ NWTIAÍOU MUELOU͂ H̔ MH͂NIGC, TÀ O̔MẂNUMA KAÌ CUNAFÉA PARALÚETAI, DECIÀ E̓PÌ DECIOI͂SI, KAÌ E̓P’ A̓RISTEROI͂SI LAIÁ. H̓̀N DÈ KATÁRXHͅ KEFALH̀, E̓PÌ MÈN TOI͂SI DECIOI͂SI TÀ LAIÀ PARALÚETAI, DECIÀ DÈ E̓P’ A̓RISTEROI͂SI. AI̓TÍH DÈ, TW͂N A̓RXÉWN TW͂N NEÚRWN H̔ E̓PALLAGH́. OU̓ GÀR KAT’ I̓́CIN TÀ DECIÀ E̓PÌ DECIÀ O̔DOIPORÉEI, MÉSFI PERATW͂NTAI, A̓LL’ E̓́MFUTA TH͂ͅ A̓RXH͂ͅ E̔́KASTA EU̓QÙS E̓P’ E̓KEI͂NA FOITH͂ͅ, A̓LLH́LOISI E̓PALLACÁMENA

div3.p: EI̓S XIASMÒN SXH́MATOS· A̓QRÓON DÈ EI̓RH͂SQAI, EI̓́TE CÚMPANTA O̔MOU͂, EI̓́TE MÉREA PARÍETAI, ........ H̓̀ CUNAMFOTÉRWN, NEU͂RA DÈ A̓́LLOTE MÈN TÀ A̓PÒ KEFALH͂S PÁSXEI· TÁDE MÉNTOI E̓S A̓NAISQHSÍHN TRÉPONTAI , W̔S E̓́POS EI̓PEI͂N· OU̓ GÀR R̔HÏDÍWS E̓S A̓KINHSÍHN E̓C W̔UTÉWN R̔ÉPEI TÁDE· KH̓̀N MÈN TOI͂SI KINEUMÉNOISI CUMPAQH́SHͅ, PÁSXEI KAÌ TÁDE SMIKRH̀N A̓KINHSÍHN· I̓́SXEI GÀR KAÌ TH̀N KÍNHSIN E̓C W̔UTÉWN, EI̓ KAÌ E̓PÌ H̔͂SSON FÚSI· A̓́LLOTE DÈ TÀ A̓PÒ MUW͂NAlthough I have not ventured to alter the reading, it appears to me, from the distinction which our author makes above between the cerebral and spinal nerves, that he refers here to the latter, and that we ought to read, NWTIAÍOU MUELOU͂; or, perhaps, the former word might be dispensed with. E̓S MÚAS PERAIOÚMENA, TÁDE TÒ KU͂ROS TH͂S KINH́SIOS I̓́SXEI, KAÌ TOI͂SI A̓PÒ TH͂S KEFALH͂S PROSDIDOI͂. KAÌ GÀR AU̓TÀ A̓P’ E̓KEÍNWN TÒ PLEI͂STON TH͂S KINH́SIOS I̓́SXEI·Ermerins does not hesitate to substitute AI̓SQH́SIOS in place of KINH́SIOS, as fancying that the sense requires this change. I̓́SXEI DÈ KAÌ E̓C E̔WUTÉWN KAÌ E̓́LATTON · TÁDE MÉNTOI A̓KINHSÍHN PÁSXEI MA͂LLON· SPÁNION DÈ EI̓́ KOTE E̓C E̔WUTÉWN EI̓S A̓NAISQHSÍHN TRÉPONTA I, DOKEI͂ KAÌ MH̀ EI̓S TÒ PÁMPAN· H̓̀N DÈ CÚNDESMÓS TIS NEÚRWN LUQH͂ͅ TW͂N E̓C O̓STÉWN PEFUKÓTWN TINÒS, KAÌ KRAINÓN TWN E̓S O̓STÉA, H̓̀ R̔AGÉNTOS,This can scarcely be the true reading. Should it not be R̔AGH͂ͅ ? A̓KRATÉA TÀ MÉREA KAÌ E̓PISURÓMENA, OU̓K A̓NAÍSQHTA, GÍGNETAI.

p.foreign: EI̓́DEA DÈ PARAPLHKTIKÀ TÁDE. A̓́LLOTE MÈN E̓S E̓́KTASIN LÉLUTAI TÀ MÉLEA, OU̓DÈ PALINDROMÉEI E̓S KÁMYIN, EU̓͂TE MH́KISTA KW͂LA FAÍNETAI· A̓́LLOTE DÈ KULLÀ GÍGNETAI, OU̓DÈ E̓S MH͂KOS A̓POTEÍNETAI· EI̓ DÈ E̓KTANÚSAI BIA͂TAI, O̔́KWS CÚLA E̓S KANÓNA
p.note: The common reading is I̔KANÀ, which appears to have no meaning. The emendation is due to Ermerins. I have adopted it; although I must be permitted to say, it is far from satisfactory. The translation given by Ermerins is: "Quasi ligna ad regulam dolaret"; but it does not seem at all appropriate to the passage.
p.foreign: KATACÉW N, TÀ MÉLEA BRAXÚTERA E̔WUTÉWN GÍGNETAI· TÁDE PÁSXEI A̓́MFW TÀ EI̓́DEA, KAÌ H̔ E̓N TOI͂S O̓FQALMOI͂SI PARQÉNOS.

KAÌ GÀR E̓KXÉETAI POLLÒN E̓S MÉGEQOS, EU̓͂TE PLATUKORÍHN O̓NOMÁZOMEN . A̓TÀR H̓DÈ CUNÁGETAI E̓S SMIKRÒN H̔ KOÚRH, EU̓͂TE FQÍSIN H̔̀N H̓DÈ MUDRÍHSIN E̓GẀ KIKLH́SKW. A̓LLÀ KAÌ KÚSTIS PARÍETAI E̓PÌ TOI͂SI I̓DÍOISI E̓́RGOISI. H̓̀ GÀR EI̓S E̓́KTASIN LÚETAI, H̓̀ A̓KRATÌ TÀ OU̓͂RA E̓KXÉEI, H̓̀ CUNEILÉETAI E̓S E̔WUTÉHN, EU̓͂TE, O̔́TAN PLHSQH͂ͅ OU̓́ROU, OU̓ DIÍ̈HSIN.

AI̓TÍAI DÈ PARÉSIOS MÈN E̔́C· A̓́RXONTAI DÈ TRẂMATI, PLHGH͂ͅ, YÚCI, A̓PEYÍHͅ, LAGNEÍHͅ, OI̓NOFLUGÍHͅ · A̓TÀR KAÌ YUXH͂S A̓KRATÉA PÁQEA, E̓KPLH́CIES, FÓBOI, DUSQUMÍAI · A̓TÀR KAÌ PAIDÍOISI DEÍMATA. PARÉLUSÉ KOTE KAÌ XÁRMA A̓DÓKHTON KAÌ MÉGA, KAÌ GÉLWS A̓́SBESTOS MÉXRI QANÁTOU. A̓LLÀ TÁDE MÈN A̓RXH̀ PRẂTH· U̔STÁTH DÈ KAÌ KAIRÍH, YÚCIS E̓MFÚTOU QERMOU͂· E̓PÌ U̔GRÓTHTI H̓̀ CHRÓTHTI PÁSXEI H̔́DE, KAÌ DUSALQH̀S TH͂S E̔TÉRHS MA͂LLON· A̓TÀR KAÌ E̓PÌ TRẂMATI KAÌ DIAKOPH͂ͅ NEÚROU A̓NALQH́S · H̔LIKÍH, GÉRONTES, KAÌ OI̔́DE DUSALQÉES· PAIDÍOISI DÈ EU̓ANÁKLHTOI· W̔́RH, XEIMẀN, E̓́AR DEÚTERON, E̓́PEITA METÓPWRON, QÉROS H̔́KISTA· E̔́CEIS, OI̔ PAXÉES KATÀ FÚSIN, U̔GROÌ, A̓RGOÌ, ZWẂDEES.

TELESQÉNTA MÈN OU̓͂N TÀ PÁQEA E̓́KDHLA A̓KINHSÍHͅ KAÌ A̓NAISQHSÍHͅ QERMOU͂ TE KAÌ YUXROU͂, A̓TÀR KAÌ TILMW͂N KAÌ KNHSMW͂N KAÌ YAUSÍWN. SPÁNION EU̓͂TE TOI͂SI TÀ PÉRATA A̓LGÉEI, A̓LLÀ E̓S A̓NÁKLHSIN OU̓ KAKÍWN H̔ A̓PONÍH. GÍGNETAI MÈN OU̓͂N E̓CAPÍNHS · H̓̀N DÉ KOTE KAÌ A̓RXÀS I̓́SXHͅ E̓PIMH́KEAS, BÁROS, DUSKINHSÍH , NÁRKH· YÚCIOS AI̓́SQHSIS, A̓́LLOTE QÁLPEOS U̔PERBOLH̀, U̔́PNOI SMIKROÌ, FANTASÍAI MÉZONES, EU̓͂TE A̓QRÓON PARELÚQHSAN.

EPÌ DÈ KUNIKW͂ͅ SPASMW͂ͅ A̔́PANTA MÈN TÀ TOU͂ PROSẂPOU MÉREA SPA͂SQAI OU̓ KÁRTA CÚNHQES · E̓PÌ DECIÀ DÈ TÀ A̓RISTERÀ, KAÌ E̓S A̓RISTERÀ TÀ DECIÀ FOITH͂ͅ, EU̓͂TE KAÌ TH͂S GÉNUOS E̓́NQA H̓̀ E̓́NQA E̓PÌ POLLÒN H̔ PARAGWGH̀, O̔́KWS E̓C E̔́DRHS KINOUMÉNHS TH͂S GNÁQOU. KAÌ GÀR KAÌ TOI͂SÍ KOTE E̓CÉBH TÒ A̓́RQRON, EU̓͂TE MÉGA XANÓNTWN E̓PÌ TÒ E̔́TERON H̔ GÉNUS PARH́XQH· I̔́LLWSIS TOU͂ O̓FQALMOU͂ TOU͂ SINAROU͂ MH́LOU, CÙN TH͂ͅ U̔POKOILÍDI PALMÓS· PÁLLETAI DÈ KAÌ TÒ A̓́NW BLÉFARON, A̓́LLOTE MÈN CÙN TW͂ͅ

O̓FQALMW͂ͅ, A̓́LLOTE DÈ MOU͂NON· CUNTEÍNETAI DÈ KAÌ TÀ XEÍLEA I̓DÍHͅ E̔KÁTERON· A̓́LLOTE DÈ A̓́MFW CUMPESÓN TA PAFLÁZEI. E̓́STI DÈ OI̔͂S MÉMUKE KÁRTA, A̓QRÓON DÈ DIÍ̈STATAI, KAÌ TÒN CUNH́QEA PTUSMÒN YOFÉEI.

SPA͂TAI KAÌ GLW͂SSA· KAÌ GÀR H̔́DE MU͂S E̓STI KAÌ NEU͂RA· EU̓͂TE PRÒS TÒN OU̓RANÒN E̓S PLÁTOS O̔́LH H̔ CÚMFUSIS A̓QRÓON A̓FH́LATO, KAÌ KLÓNOU PÁTAGON E̓POÍHSE. SPA͂TAI DÈ KAÌ KÍWN, KAÌ EI̓ MÈN TÒ STÓMA SUNÁGEI, TA̓́NDOQEN A̓DÓKHTOS O̔ PÁTAGOS· H̓̀N DÈ DIASTH́S Hͅ TÒ STÓMA, O̓́YEAI TH̀N KIONÍDA, A̓́LLOTE MÈN PROSFUOMÉNHN E̓S PLÁTOS TW͂ͅ OU̓RANW͂ͅ, A̓́LLOTE DÈ A̓POPALLOMÉNHN BÍHͅ W̓KÉWS SWLH͂NI O̔MOÍWS, EU̓͂TE KAÌ H̓́DH PATAGEI͂. A̓PÁTH DÉ TOI CÚNESTI TOI͂SI KUNIKOI͂SI SPASMOI͂SI. DOKÉEI GÀR TOI͂SI QEWMÉNOISI TÀ A̓PÁQEA TH̀N NOU͂SON I̓́SXEIN. TH͂ͅ GÀR PERITÁSEI KAÌ TH͂ͅ XROIH͂ͅ KAÌ TW͂ͅ TOU͂ O̓FQALMOU͂ MÉZONI, U̔GIÉA TÀ SINARÀ FAÍNETAI. E̓LÉGXETAI DÈ KAÌ E̓NGÉLWTI KAÌ LALIH͂ͅ KAÌ KATAMÚSEI. TÀ MÉN GE SINARÀ SPA͂TAI PÁNTA PATÁGWͅ, XEI͂LOS A̓MEIDÈS, A̓KÍNHTON H̓̀N LALH͂ͅ, BLÉFARON OU̓K E̓PÍTROXON, O̓FQALMÒS A̓TENH̀S, A̓NAÍSQHTOS H̔ A̔FH́· TÀ DÈ U̔GIÉA LALEI͂, KATAMÚEI, AI̓SQÁNETAI , GELA͂ͅ.

div3.p: HN E̔́LKOS E̓C A̓POSTÁSIOS E̓N TW͂ͅ PNEÚMONI GÉNHTAI, H̓̀ E̓K BHXÒS XRONÍHS, H̓̀ A̓NAGWGH͂S AI̔́MATOS, KAÌ A̓NABH́SSHͅ PU͂ON, PÚH, Ermerins does not appear to me to be warranted in substituting FQÓH for PÚH, contrary to the authority of all the MSS. Moreover, it seems to be excluded from this place by the terms in which our author applies FQÓH to a particular state of the diseased parts-- A̓LLÀ FQÓHN METALAMBÁNEI; i.e. "but the disease assumes the peculiar name of Phthoe." He is right, however, in following the suggestion of Petit, and substituting E̔́LKOS for E̓NTÒS at the commencement. KAÌ FQÍSIS KIKLH́SKETAI· H̓̀N DÈ QẂRHC H̓̀ PLEURÒN E̓MPUH́SHͅ, E̓PANÁGHTAI

DÈ DIÀ TOU͂ PNEÚMONOS, E̓MPÚH H̔́DE TOU̓́NOMA.I am not aware that the term E̓MPÚH occurs elsewhere. Hippocrates and Galen, I believe, universally use the substantive E̓MPÚHMA, or the adjective E̓́MPUOI- - the latter being their more common practice. H̓̀N DÈ E̓PÌ TOI͂SI KAÌ O̔ PNEÚMWN E̔́LKOS I̔́SXHͅ, A̓NABRWQEÌS U̔PÒ TOU͂ DIENEXQÉNTOS PÚOU, TOU̓́NOMA OU̓KÉTI E̓MPÚH, A̓LLÀ FQÓHN METALAMBÁNEI· CÚNESTI DÈ KAÌ PU͂R CUNEXÈS, W̔S MH̀ DOKÉEIN,At first I was inclined to adopt the alteration of Ermerins, who substitutes MOI for MH̀; but, after reading Cælius Aurelianus's description of Phthisis, I was convinced that MH̀ is the preferable reading. The words of Aurelianus are: "Sequitur autem ægrotantes febricula latens," etc. LH͂GON MÈN OU̓́KOTE, LH͂QON DÈ DI’ H̔MÉRHS I̔DRW͂TI KAÌ YÚCI TOU͂ SKH́NEOS. KAÌ GÀR KAÌ TÀ I̓́DIA FQÓHS E̓STÌ, H̓̀N H̔ QÉRMH ZWPURH͂ͅ, KAÌ E̓S NÚKTA E̓KLÁMPHͅ, H̔MÉRHN DÈ AU̓͂QIS E̓N TOI͂SI SPLÁGXNOISI FWLEÚEI · DHLOI͂ DÈ H̔ DUSFORÍH, KAÌ H̔ A̓DUNAMÍH, KAÌ AI̔ CUNTH́CIES. H̓̀N GÀR A̓PEDÍDRHSKE TOU͂ SKH́NEOS DI’ H̔MÉRHS TÒ PU͂R, PW͂S OU̓K A̓̀N E̓SARKOU͂ TÓ TE KAÌ H̓DÚNATO, KAÌ EU̓FÓRWS EI̓͂XEN W̔́NQRWPOS; EU̓͂TE GÀR A̓NÁGEI, E̓PÌ MA͂LLON TÀ DEINÀ AU̓CÉETAI.I am not satisfied with A̓NÁGEI in this sentence; but have not been able to find a proper substitute for it. The translation of Crassus is most suitable to the context: "ut enim recessit," etc. Qu. A̓NÉQHͅ? SFUGMOÌ SMIKROÌ KAÌ A̓MUDROÌ, A̓GRUPNH̀, A̓́XROIA, KAÌ TA̓́LLA PÁNTA O̔KÓSA OI̔ PURETAÍNONTES· I̓DÉAI DÈ U̔GRW͂N MURÍAI, PELIDNW͂N, MELÁNWN KATAKORÉWN , H̓̀ W̓XROLEÚKWN , H̓̀ LEUKOXLWRÉWN· PLATÉWN, STROGGÚLWN · SKLHRW͂N, DUSLÚTWN, H̓̀ MANW͂N, LUOMÉNWN· H̓̀ A̓NÓSMWN, H̓̀ KAKWDÉWN· A̔́PANTA DÈ TÁDE PÚOU E̓́ASI I̓DÉAI. O̔KÓSOI GÀR H̓̀ PURÌ H̓̀ U̔́DATI TÀ U̔GRÀ TEKMAÍRONTAI, OU̓ KÁRTA MOI DOKÉOUSI FQÓHN OI̔́DE GIGNẂSKEIN · PISTOTÉRH GÀR H̔ O̓́YIS A̔PÁSHS A̓́LLHS AI̓SQH́SIOS, OU̓ TW͂N A̓NAGOMÉNWN MOU͂NON, A̓LLÀ KAÌ TOU͂ EI̓́DEOS TOU͂ NOSÉONTOS. H̓̀N GÀR KAÌ DHMÓTHS I̓́DHͅ TÒN A̓́NQRWPON W̓XRÒN, A̓DRANH͂, A̓NABH́SSONTA, CUNTETHKÓTA, A̓TREKÉA MANTEÚETAI FQÓHN· A̓TÀR H̓DÈ O̔KÓSOISI MÈN E̔́LKOS MÈN OU̓K E̓́STI E̓N PNEÚMONI, CUNTETH́KASI DÈ PURETOI͂SI XRONÍOISI, PUKNÀ DÈ KAÌ SKLHRÀ KAÌ A̓TELÉA

BH́SSOUSI, KAÌ A̓NÁGOUSI OU̓DÈN, KAÌ TOÚSDE FQISIKOÙS KIKLH́SKOUSI, OU̓ PÁNU A̓SH́MWS. CÚNESTI DÈ TOU͂ QẂRHKOS BÁROS· PLEÚMWN GÀR A̓́PONOS,In all the MSS. and editions, except that of Ermerins, we read A̓́TONOS, which is unsuitable to the place. A̓́SH, DUSFORÍH, A̓POSITÍH, E̔SPÉRHͅ PERÍYUCIS, KAÌ QÉRMH E̓S TH̀N E̔́W· I̔DRẀS A̓́XRI QẂRHKOS TH͂S QÉRMHS DUSFORẂTEROS· BHXÒS A̓NAGWGAÌ POIKÍLAI, O̔KOÍAS E̓́LECA.

p.foreign: FWNH̀ BRAGXẂDHS· AU̓XH̀N U̔POSKÓLIOS, R̔ADINÒS, OU̓K EU̓PARÁGWGOS· O̔KOI͂ÓN TI CUNTETA MÉNOS· DÁKTULOI I̓SXNOÌ, TÀ DÈ A̓́RQRA PAXÉA· O̓STÉWN MOÚNWN H̔ I̓DÉH· SMÚXONTAI GÀR KAÌ SÁRKES· O̓́NUXES GRUPOÌ DAKTÚLWN, AI̔ KOILÍAI R̔USAÌ KAÌ PLATÉES·
p.note: Ermerins, on his own authority, substitutes PLATÉAI; but the other reading is in accordance with a well-known Ionic usage. All the recent translators have fallen into the mistake of applying this passage to the abdomen; whereas a careful examination of the context will show that it is out of the question in this place. Crassus more correctly renders it thus: "Digitorum ventres rugosi et lati." KOILÍAI in this place evidently applies to the pulps of the fingers.
p.foreign: U̔P’ A̓SARKÍAS GÀR OU̓́TE TH̀N PERITAINÍHN OU̓́TE TÒ STROGGÚLON I̓́SXOUSI. DIÀ TÓDE KAÌ O̓́NUXES GRUPOÍ· H̔́DE GÀR H̔ A̓NAKWXH̀, KAÌ H̔ U̔PÓSTASIS AU̓TÉWN, H̔́TIS E̓N TH͂ͅSI KORUFH͂ͅSI PEPLHSMÉNH EI̔́NEKEN AU̓TW͂N· E̓́STI KAÌ O̔ TÓNOS, W̔́SPER KAÌ TÀ STEREÁ·
p.note: In this passage we are under obligations to Ermerins; in particular for supplying TÓNOS instead of PÓNOS. I have not adopted his other alterations.
p.foreign: R̔ÌS O̓CEÍH, I̓SXNH̀, MH͂LA U̔PERÍSXONTA KAÌ E̓RUQRÀ, O̓FQALMOÌ KOI͂LOI, STILPNOÌ, GANÓWNTES · OI̓DALÉOI, KAÌ W̓XROÌ, H̓̀ PELIDNOÌ TÀ PRÓSWPA. MÉSA TW͂N PLEURÉWN KOI͂LA, R̔OMBOEIDÉA.
p.note: This word is most probably a false reading. See Wigan and Ermerins. The latter reads R̔OIBOEIDÉA, one of Wigan's conjectural emendations. ROIKOEIDÉA and R̔EBOEIDÉA have also been suggested. If I thought myself warranted to make any change in the reading, it would be to adopt R̔AIBOEIDÉA. See Foes, Œc. Hipp.; and Galen, t. i. pp. 224, 246, ed. Daremberg.

OI̔͂SI E̓N TH͂ͅSI KOILÍHͅSI TÀ A̓́NW
p.note: Although not inclined to adopt unauthorised emendations, I must say that I think this reading, on the authority of Ermerins, is a great improvement on the common reading, TOU͂ A̓NQRẂPOU. In the MSS. of Aretæus, it is quite common to find A̓NQRẂPOU written A̓́NW, by contraction.
p.foreign: KAT’ I̓́CIN TOU͂ QẂRHKOS H̓̀ TÀ KÁTW U̔PÒ TÒ DIÁFRAGMA PÚOU A̓POSTÁSIES GÍGNONTAI, H̓̀N MÈN A̓NÁGWSI, E̓́MPUOI OI̔́DE KALÉONTAI· H̓̀N DÈ TÒ PU͂ON DIECÍHͅ KÁTW, A̓POSTHMATÍAI KIKLH́SKONTAI· KAÌ E̓N MÈN QẂRHKI E̓N TOI͂SI E̔́LKESI, H̓́TOI E̓N PLEÚMONI, H̔̀N E̓KDÉXETAI FQÓH, H̓̀ U̔PEZWKÓTI E̓N

PLEURW͂ͅ, H̓̀ STÉRNWͅ, H̓̀ KÁTWPH PRÒS TH͂ͅ CUMFÚSI TOU͂ PNEÚMONOS KATÀ R̔ÁXIN, H̓́ PH TOU͂ QẂRHKOS A̓́LLHͅ,-- CUMPÁNTWN DÈ E̓S A̓NAGWGH̀N O̔DÒS TW͂ͅ PÚWͅ PNEÚMWN. U̔PÒ DÈ TÒ DIÁFRAGMA E̓N TOI͂SI SPLÁGXNOISI, H̔́PATI, SPLHNÌ, NEFROI͂SI, KÚSTIS · E̓PÌ GUNAIKW͂N DÈ KAÌ U̔STÉRH· E̓́TAMON DÈ KAÌ E̓GẀ E̓N KẂLWͅ TINÍ KOTE A̓PÓSTASIN TÀ E̓PÌ DECIÀ PRÒS H̔́PATI· KAÌ POLLÓN TI E̓SSÚQH E̓́CW PU͂ON· POLLÒN DÈ KAÌ DIÀ NEFRW͂N KAÌ KÚSTIOS E̓S H̔MÉRAS PLEU͂NAS E̓RRÚH, KAÌ PERIEGÉNETO W̔́NQRWPOS.

AI̓TÍAI DÈ CUNAÌ MÈN A̔PÁNTWN PLHGH̀, A̓PEYÍH, YÚCIS, H̓DÈ O̔KOI͂A TOIÁDE. TOI͂SI DÈ E̓N QẂRHKI, BH̀C XRONÍH, KAÌ PLEURI͂TIS, KAÌ PERIPNEUMONÍH, KAÌ R̔EU͂MA XRÓNION · A̓TÀR H̓DÈ O̓CEÍAS NOÚSOU E̓S E̔́N TI TOUTÉWN A̓PÓSKHYIS.

TÒ DÈ U̔GRÒN A̓́LLOTE MÈN A̓ERGÒN, A̓DRANÈS, E̓GKÉETAÍ TWͅ A̓́LLWͅ· A̓́LLOTE MÈN DRIMÙ DAPTW͂S, KAÌ SHPEDÓNAS E̓MPOIÉON MÉSFI QANÁTOU. KAÌ GÀR KAÌ I̓DÉAI MURÍAI, O̔KÓSAS AU̓͂QIS FRÁSW. QẂÜMA DÈ O̔́KWS E̓C U̔MÉNOS LEPTOU͂TE KAÌ I̓SXNOU͂, BÁQOS OU̓K I̓́SXONTOS, TOU͂ U̔PEZWKÓTOS, TOSÓNDE R̔ÉEI PU͂ON· POLLÒN GÀR POLLOI͂SI CUNELÉGH. AI̓TÍH DÈ FLEGMASÍH A̓PÒ PERIOUSÍHS AI̔́MATOS, E̓F’ H̔͂ͅ PAXÚNETAI O̔ U̔MH̀N, A̓TÀR H̓DÈ E̓K POLLOU͂ AI̔́MATOS POLLÒN GÍGNETAI E̓N MÉSWͅ PU͂ON· KH̓̀N MÈN EI̓́SW R̔ÉPHͅ, AI̔ PLEURAÌ TÀ O̓STÉA KATÀ XẂRAN TH̀N SFW͂N AU̓TÉWN,... ...... FQÍSIN E̓́LECA PRÓSQEN E̔TÉRAN E̓́MMENAI SUMBEBW͂ SAN KATÀ FÚSIN· H̓̀N DÈ E̓́CW R̔ÉPHͅ, DIÍ̈STATAI TÀ O̓STÉA. E̓S GÀR E̔́N TI TW͂N MÉSWN PLEURW͂N TH͂S A̓POSTÁSIOS H̔ KORUFH̀ E̓GEÍRETAI, EU̓͂TE E̓́NQA KAÌ E̓́NQA PLEURÀ PARWQÉETAI.

OU̓ GÀR E̓́TI FÚSIS E̓́RGOU E̓́XETAI. OU̓ GÀR PÉYIS

O̔KOÍH PRÓSQEN, OU̓K EU̓SARKÍH, XROIH̀ ZOFẂDHS · A̓NAPNOH̀ PA͂SI MÈN KAKH̀, KAKÍWN DÈ OI̔͂SI E̓S TH̀N A̓́NW KOILÍHN. A̓TÀR KAÌ BH̀C TÀ PRW͂TA, MÉSFI A̓̀N H̔ FLEGMASÍH PIÉZEI, EU̓͂TE KAÌ PÓNOI MÉZONES KAÌ R̔ÍGEA, KAÌ QÉRMH, KAÌ A̓GRUPNÍH, KAÌ DÚSPNOIA E̓́TI MA͂LLON· SFUGMOÌ SMIKROÌ, NWQROÌ, A̓DRANÉES, TH̀N GNẂMHN PARÁLHROI, DIÁTASIS TOU͂ QẂRHKOS.

E̔́PETAI DÈ TOUTÉOISI PU͂ON, H̓̀ DIÀ KOILÍHS, H̓̀ OU̓́RWN· A̓GAQAÌ DÈ PÁNTWN MA͂LLON, AI̔ E̓S NEFROÙS KAÌ KÚSTIAS METALH́YIES.

PROSCUN IÉNAI DÈ TOUTÉOISI KAÌ TH̀N E̔́CIN, KAÌ TÀ CUNOMARTÉONTATH͂ͅ NOÚSWͅ. H̓̀N GÀR E̓PÌ TH͂ͅ E̓KKRÍSI EU̓FÓRWS FÉRHͅ, A̓́PUROS GÍGNHTAI, EU̓͂TE PÉSSHͅ, EU̓́XROUS, EU̓́SITOS · H̓̀N A̓NABH́SSHͅ

EU̓MARW͂S, EU̓́SFUKTOS, EU̓́TONOS GÍGNHTAI, A̓NẂLEQROS O̔ NOSÉWN· H̓̀N DÈ E̓PIPURETAÍNHͅ, KAÌ PÁNTA E̓S KAKÒN TRÉPHTAI, A̓NÉLPISTOS . PROSCUNIÉNAI DÈ KAÌ TÀ XWRÍA, E̓́NQA AI̔ A̓POSTÁSIES · O̔KÓSOISI GÀR E̓N TW͂ͅ STÉRNWͅ TÒ E̓MPÚHMA GÍGNETAI, BRADÉWS A̓FÍSTATAI. YILÀ GÀR KAÌ A̓́SARKA KAÌ XONDRẂDEA TÀ MÉREA· TÀ DÈ TOIÁDE OU̓ R̔HÏDÍWS DÉXETAI FLEGMON H͂S PERIOUSÍHN · A̓NEKPÚHTA DÈ MÍMNEI POULÙN XRÓNON· YUXRÒN GÀR OI̔ XÓNDROI, A̓LLÀ TW͂NDE A̓SINÉES MÈN AI̔ FLEGMONAÍ, TH͂S E̔́CIOS DÈ KAKAÌ SUNTH́CIES, MAKRÒN GÀR DIAPUÍ̈SKEI XRÓNON. SPLH̀N KAÌ H̔͂PAR KAÌ PNEÚMWN KAÌ DIÁFRAGMA O̓CÚTERA MÈN E̓S E̓MPÚHSIN, E̓PIKÍNDUNA DÈ KAÌ QANATẂDEA.

head.foreign: KEF. I’. PERÌ TW͂N KATÀ TÒN PNEÚMONA A̓POSTÁSEWN.

p.foreign: EU̓͂TE O̔KÓSOISI PERIPNEUMON IKOI͂SI A̓̀N FLÉGMA E̓́Hͅ, KAÌ MH̀ DIAXÉHTAI, PERIGÍGNONTAI· OI̔ DÈ DIADIDRH́SKONTES TÒ KÁTOCU TOU͂ PÁQEOS E̓́MPUOI GÍGNONTAI. TÀ MÈN OU̓͂N MELLOÚSHS H̓̀ TETELES MÉNHS A̓POSTÁSIOS SHMEI͂A E̓N TOI͂SI E̓MPÚOISI E̓́LECA· H̓̀N DÈ TELESQH͂ͅ, OU̓ BÍHS KAÌ PÓNWN E̓S A̓PÓRRHCIN KAÌ A̓NAGWGH̀N XRÉOS, O̔́PWSPER E̓N TOI͂SI SẂMASI· A̓LLÀ GÀR R̔HÏDÍWS A̓NAFÉRETAI , DIATÁSIOS MA͂LLON TW͂N A̓RAIWSÍWN GENOMÉNHS, H̓́PER E̔́CIOS SWMÁTWN. MANÒS GÀR KAÌ POLÚTRHTOS O̔ PNEÚMWN, SPOGGÍHͅ I̓́KELOS, OU̓ XALEPAÍNWN TW͂ͅ U̔GRW͂ͅ, A̓́LLHN A̓P’ A̓́LLHS EU̓RUXWRÍHN A̓MEÍBONTI, MÉSFI TH͂S TRHXEÍHS A̓RTHRÍHS H̔́KEIN. PERÍODOI DÈ TW͂ͅ U̔GRW͂ͅ R̔HÍ̈DIAI. EU̓KAMPÈS GÀR H̓DÈ O̓LISQHRÒN PU͂ON. A̓TÀR KAÌ H̔ A̓NAPNOH̀ A̓́NW TÒ PNEU͂MA FUSH͂ͅ.
p.note: Although I have not meddled with the text, I cannot but think that we ought to read either PU͂ON or U̔GRÒN, instead of PNEU͂MA.
p.foreign: PERIGÍGNONTAI DÈ TÀ POLLÀ, EI̓ MH́ KOTÉ TIS A̓PEPNIGH͂ A̓QRÓHͅ E̔LKÚSI TOU͂ U̔GROU͂, TH͂S A̓RTHRÍHS OU̓ DEXOMÉNHS TÒN H̓ÉRA PLH́QEÏ TOU͂ PÚOU. QNH́SKOU SI DÈ METECÉTEROI XRÓNWͅ TÒN FQINẂDEA

KAÌ TÒN E̓MPUÏKW͂N TRÓPON· TÀ DÈ PU͂A LEUKÀ, E̓́PAFRA, SIÁLWͅ MEMIGMÉNA· A̓́LLOTE D’ AU̓͂ TEFROEIDÉA , H̓̀ U̔POMELANÍZONTA· KAÌ BROGXÍON KOTÈ A̓NEPTÚSQH E̓PÌ POIKÍLWͅ E̔́LKEÏ, H̓̀N BÁQOS I̓́SXHͅ H̔ A̓PÓSTASIS, EU̓͂TE KAÌ A̓PORRW͂GES A̓NAFÉRONTAI TOU͂ SPLÁGXNOU. BRAGXẂDEES , BRAXÚPNOOI , BARÚFWNOI, TÀ STH́QEÁ SFIN EU̓RÉA GÍGNETAI, KAÌ EU̓RUTÉRWN TH͂S U̔GRASÍHS DÉONTAI.
p.note: Surely some such word as DIÀ is wanting before TH͂S U̔GRASÍHS, or the text is otherwise at fault.
p.foreign: O̓FQALMW͂N TÀ MÉLANA STILPNÁ· TÀ DÈ LEUKÀ, LEUKÓTA TA KAÌ PÍONA· MH͂LA E̓REUQH͂, FLÉBES E̓N TW͂ͅ PROSẂPWͅ KURTAÍ. QẂÜMA DÈ E̓PÌ TOUTÉWN. TÓNOS MÈN GÀR EU̓SARKÍHS MEÍZWN, EU̓YUXÍN DÈ TÓNOU DUNATWTÉRH.

EI̓ A̓PÒ DRÓMOU KAÌ GUMNASÍWN KAÌ PANTÒS E̓́RGOU DUSPNOEI͂ H̔ A̓NAPNOH̀, A̓͂SQMA KALEI͂TAI· KAÌ H̔ NOU͂SOS DÈ O̓RQÓPNOIA, KAÌ H̔́DE KIKLH́SKETAI A̓͂SQMA· E̓N GÀR TOI͂SI PAROCUSMOI͂SI A̓SQMAÍNOUSI KAÌ OI̔́DE. O̓RQÓPNOIAN DÈ E̓KÁLEON, OU̔́NEKEN O̓RQÍWͅ SXH́MATI MOU͂NON A̓NAPNÉOUSI EU̓FÓRWS · PNÌC GÀR E̓N KATAKLÍSI . EI̔́NEKEN TOU͂ TÓNOU TOU͂ E̓PÌ TW͂ͅ PNEÚMATI O̓RQÓPNOIA TOU̓́NOMA.
p.note: Ermerins suppresses the last clause of the sentence altogether, on the ground that it is superfluous and out of place. I fear this must be held to be an unwarrantable liberty on the part of an editor, whose duty it is to restore the words, but not attempt to improve the sense of his author.
p.foreign: O̓́RQIOS GÀR A̓NATÉTATAI E̓S A̓NAPNOH̀N, KH̓̀N U̔́PTIOS KATAKLINQH͂ͅ W̔́NQRWPOS, KÍNDUNOS PNIGH͂NAI.
PÁSXEI DÈ PLEÚMWN· CUMPAQÉEI DÈ KAÌ TÀ CUNTELOU͂NTA E̓S A̓NAPNOH̀N, DIÁFRAGMA, QẂRHC· H̓̀N DÈ KARDÍH PÁQHͅ, OU̓́KOTE E̓S POLLÒN DIARKÉSEIE . TH͂ͅDE GÀR H̔ TH͂S A̓NAPNOH͂S KAÌ TH͂S ZWH͂S A̓RXH́.

div3.p: AI̓TÍH DÈ YÚCIS KAÌ U̔GRÓTHS TOU͂ PNEÚMATOS·Ermerins agrees with Petit in reading PNEÚMONOS. I am doubtful. U̔́LH DÈ U̔GRÀ,

p.foreign: PAXÉA, KOLLẂDEA· EU̓PAQÉES DÈ GUNAI͂KES A̓NDRW͂N MA͂LLON, O̔́TI PER U̔GRAÍ TE KAÌ YUXRAÍ· OI̔ DÈ PAI͂DES TOÚTWN PERIGÍGNONTAI R̔HÍ̈TERON, H̔ GÀR FÚSIS E̓N AU̓CH́SI QERMH͂NAI DUNATWTÁTH . A̓́NDRES DÈ EI̓ KAÌ MH̀ R̔HÍ̈DIOI PAQEI͂N, A̓LLÀ QNH́SKOUSI QA͂SSON. A̓MBOLH̀ DÈ QANÁTOU O̔́SOISI E̓N E̓́RGOU PRH́CI, H̓̀ E̓N EI̓RÍOISI PLEÚMWN QÁLPETAI KAÌ DIAÍQETAI, O̔KOI͂ÓN TI TOI͂SI TH͂S TITÁNOU E̓RGÁTHͅSI, H̓̀ XALKEU͂SI, H̓̀ SIDHREU͂SI, H̓̀ KAÌ LOUTRW͂N PURSEUTH͂RSI.

p.note: Wigan and Ermerins read R̔WXMÒS; but the other seems to me the preferable term. The authority of Cælius Aurelianus seems to me decisive on this point: "Gutturis stridor quem Græci rhogmon vocant." Morb. Acut. ii. 10. See PAULUS ÆGINETA, t. i. p. 482, Syd. Soc. Edit.

A̓͂SQMA A̓RAIÒN, LEI͂ON, KERXNW͂DES.
p.note: I am not satisfied that Ermerins was warranted in prefixing OU̓ to KERXNW͂DES, contrary to the authority of all the MSS.
p.foreign: W̔͂DE MÈN OU̓͂N DIADIDRH́SKOUSI TÒN O̓́LEQRON E̓N DÈ TH͂ͅSI E̓PANÉSESI, KH̓̀N PERIÍ̈WSI O̓RQOSTÁDHN, TOU͂ PÁQEOS FÉROUSI CÚMBOLA.

ASQMATOS I̓DÉH TÒ PNEUMW͂DES, KAÌ A̓PÒ TOU͂ PNEÚMONOS TÒ PÁQOS O̔́KWS E̓P’ A̓́SQMATI. CUNÀ GÀR KAÌ TÀ PAREÓNTA · SMIKRÒN DÈ KAÌ TÒ DIÁFORON. DÚSPNOIA MÈN GÀR KAÌ BH̀C KAÌ A̓GRUPNÍH KAÌ QÉRMH CUNÁ· KAÌ A̓POSITÍH KAÌ I̓SXNÓTHS O̔́LOU. KAÌ GÀR E̓S XRÓNON
p.note: I follow Wigan and Ermerins in adopting this reading in place of AI̓SXRÒN O̓́N.
p.foreign: TÒ KAKÒN A̓POTEÍNETAI, PLH̀N OU̓ PERAITÉRW E̔NÒS E̓́TEOS. H̓́N TE GÀR TÒ METÓPWRON A̓́RCHͅ, EI̓S TÒ E̓́AR H̓̀ TÒ QÉROS A̓POGÍGNONTAI· H̓́N TE XEIMẀN, E̓S TÒ METÓPWRON TELEUTW͂SI TÒN BÍON. KOTÈ KAÌ GÉRONTES A̔LW͂NAI R̔HÍ̈DIOI KAÌ A̓PÓFRIKTOI A̔LÓNTES, O̔́SON BRAXEÍHS R̔OPH͂S E̓S EU̓NH̀N QANÁTOU XRÉOS·
p.note: I must say, I have never been able to satisfy myself with any interpretation of this passage which I have seen. Ermerins, indeed, very properly remarks, that in this sentence there is an indirect reference to a celebrated verse in the Oedipus Tyrannus of Sophocles; namely-- SMIKRÀ PALAIÀ SẂMAT’ EU̓NÁZEI R̔OPH́--that is, "A slight inclination of the scale sets old persons asleep in death." But then A̓PÓFRIKTOI A̔LÓNTES create difficulty, inasmuch as the adjective never occurs elsewhere, as far as I am aware; and, moreover, I do not see how a shivering fit should necessarily occasion death. Instead of it, I would prefer A̓PÓFRAKTOI; that is to say, with the meaning, "being seized with obstructed respiration." Still, however, there is a difficulty, inasmuch as it would not be easy to find any authority for this participle, although the verb be not uncommon. See Liddel and Scott. One might think of A̓PÓPLHKTOI, which would be a very suitable term, as this is a very natural cause of sudden death in asthma.

p.foreign: A̓́GXISTA A̔́PANTES A̓́PNOOI, SFUGMOÌ SMIKROÌ, PUKNOÌ, A̓MUDROÍ. A̓LLÀ TÁDE MÈN CUNÀ PRÒS TÒ A̓͂SQMA· I̓DÍAͅ DÈ A̓NABH́SSOUSI W̔S A̓NÁCONTES. MATAIOPONÉOUSI DÉ· OU̓DÈN GÀR A̓NÁGOUSI. EI̓ DÉ TI TOU͂ PLEÚMONOS A̓PORRAGEÍH BÍHͅ, SMIKRÒN, LEUKÒN, STROGGÚLON , XALAZW͂DES · QẂRHC EU̓RÚTEROS MÈN, A̓DIÁSTROFOS, H̓DÈ A̓NÉLKWTOS· H̓̀N DÈ A̓NEKPÚHTOS O̔ PNEÚMWN H̓͂ͅ, U̔GRW͂N DÈ O̔KOI͂ÓN TI PEPHGÓTWN E̓́MPLEWS, DIALH́YIES TW͂N PAROCUSMW͂N TOU͂DE MÉZONES. HPAR SPLHNÌ E̓S GÉNESIN MÈN I̓SÓRROPON· DECIÀ GÀR H̓DÈ E̓P’ A̓RISTERÀ TÀ SPLÁGXNA I̓SÁRIQMA TH͂ͅ FÚSI· A̓́NISOI DÈ E̓S DÚNAMIN KAÌ E̓N U̔GEÍHͅ KAÌ E̓N NOÚSOISI. E̓N U̔GEÍHͅ MÈN, O̔́TIPER TÒ KRÁTOS TH͂S TROFH͂S TÒ H̔͂PAR I̓́SXEI· R̔ÍZWSIS GÀR FLEBW͂N H̔͂PAR·

U̔PÒ GÀR TOU͂ A̓́XQEOS E̔́LKETAI TÒ DIÁFRAGMA, E̓C OU̔͂ TÒ H̔͂PAR H̓́RTHTAI · TÒ DÈ DIÁFRAGMA TÒN U̔PÒ TH͂ͅSI PLEURH͂ͅSI U̔MÉNA BRÍQEI· CUNH͂PTAI GÀR AU̓TÉWͅ· O̔ DÈ E̓PÌ TH̀N KLHI͂¨DA H̓DÈ A̓́KRW TW͂N W̓́MWN A̓POTÉTATAI, KAÌ TÁDE CUNEFÉLKETAI KÁTW. PU͂R DRIMÙ CÙN R̔ÍGESI E̓PÌ TH͂ͅ A̓POSTÁSEI, BH̀C CHRH̀, OU̓ MÁLA PUKINH̀, XROIH̀ XLOH́BAFOS. H̓̀N DÈ KATAKOR ÉWS E̓́WSIN I̓KTERẂDEES , TOU͂ LEUKOXRÓOU EI̓́DEOS· U̔́PNOI KAQAROÌ FANTASÍHS OU̓ MÁLA. NHFALÉOI MÈN E̓S PÁNTA· E̓S E̔̀N DÉ TI TW͂N PROSKAÍRWN E̓CAPÍNHS PARAKOPAÌ, KAÌ KATESTÁQHSAN EU̓QÉWS· O̓́GKOS U̔PÒ TITQH͂ͅSI H̓̀ PLEURH͂ͅSI, A̓PÁTH DÈ POLLOI͂SI O̔́KWS PERITONAÍOU GÍGNETAI. A̓LL’ H̓̀N MÈN H̓͂ͅ U̔PÒ TÀS NÓQAS O̓́GKOS KAÌ O̓DÚNH PIEZEUMÉNOIS, TÒ H̔͂PAR OI̓DÉEI· E̓́MPLEWN GÀR U̔GRASÍHS· H̓̀N DÈ MH̀ U̔PÒ TÒ O̓STÉON MÍMNWSI OI̓DÉEI[In most of the editions there is the mark of a lacuna before these words; and Ermerins suppresses them altogether, as being redundant. No lacuna appears in any of our British MSS. which I have examined.], TOU͂ U̔MÉNOS TÒ SHMEI͂ON · KAÌ TOU͂ MÈN PERIGRAFH͂ͅ KAÌ TÀ O̔́RIA DH͂LA· METÀ GÀR TH̀N PERIAGWGH̀N TW͂N LOBW͂N E̓S LAGARÒN TÒ E̓PIGÁSTRION PIÉZOUSA XEÌRI̔ZÁNEI· PERITONAÍOU DÈ A̓ÓRISTOS H̔ SKLHRÍH KAÌ TOU͂ PÉRATOS H̔ A̓PÓFUSIS A̓FANH́S. H̓̀N MÈN EI̓́SW H̔ A̓PÓSTASIS R̔ÉPHͅ, POLLÓN TI KRÉSSON H̔ FÚSIS I̓HTROU͂· H̓̀ GÀR E̓S E̓́NTERA, H̓̀ E̓PÌ KÚSTIN TRÉYEI TÒ PU͂ON· A̓SINESTÉRH DÈ POLLÒN H̔ E̓S KÚSTIN O̔DÓS. H̓̀N DÈ E̓́CW R̔ÉPHͅ, KAKÒN MÈN MH̀ TÁMNEIN. H̓́N TE GÀR OU̔́TWS E̓́Hͅ, A̓NESQÍE TAI U̔PÒ TOU͂ PÚOU TÒ H̔͂PAR, KAÌ OU̓K E̓S A̓MBOLH̀N O̔ QÁNATOS. H̓̀N DÈ QÉLHͅS TÁMNEIN, AI̔MORRAGH͂SAI KÍNDUNOS, KAÌ AU̓TÍKA TÒN A̓́NQRWPON E̓KQANEI͂N. A̓́SXETOS GÀR AI̔MORRAGÍH E̓F’ H̔́PATI. H̓̀N OU̓͂N E̓S A̓NÁGKHN TOMH͂S KATÍHͅS KOTÈ, KAUTH͂RA E̓́MPURON DIAFANÉA PURW͂SAI, KAÌ DIW͂SAI MÉSFI TOU͂ PÚOU. TWU̓TÒ GÁR SOI TÉMNEI TE KAÌ KAÍEI. KAÌ H̓̀N PERIGÍGNHTAI, PU͂ON E̓KREÚSEI LEUKÒN, PÉPON, LEI͂ON, KAKW͂DES, O̔́TI PAXÚ· TOI͂SDE KAÌ PURETOÌ KAÌ TÀ DEINÀ CUNDIDOI͂· R̔HÏDÍWS TE

HN DÈ A̓NEKPÚHTON TÒ E̔́LKOS GÍGNHTAI, KAÌ KAKẂDEA H̔ GASTH̀R O̔KOI͂ÓN TI SHPEDÓNA U̔PÁGEI, TROFH̀ A̓́PEPTOS DIEKQÉEI U̔P’ A̓KRASÍH S KOILÍHS TE KAÌ E̓NTÉRWN. OU̓ PÉPTEI GÀR AU̓͂QIS EU̓͂ E̓́XON TÒ H̔͂PAR· PU͂R TE E̓PÌ TOI͂SDE DRIMÙ, KAÌ PÁNTWS E̓S KAKÒN H̔ TROPH́. SARKW͂N CUNTH́CIES, SFUGMOÌ SMIKROÌ, DÚSPNOOI, EU̓͂TE OU̓K EI̓S MAKRÒN E̓TELEÚT HSAN TÒN BÍON. METECETÉROISI DÈ H̔ DUSENTERÍH MÈN KAÌ TÒ E̔́LKOS I̓H́QH, E̓S U̔́DRWPA DÈ KATÉSTREYE H̔ NOU͂SOS. H̓̀N DÈ A̔́PANTA CUNDIDW͂ͅ, PU͂ON LEUKÒN, LEI͂ON, O̔MALÒN, A̓́NOSMON GÀR E̓KRÉEI, H̔ GASTH̀R PÉTTEITE TÀ SITÍA, EU̓́ELPIS W̔́NQRWPOS.
p.note: I at first changed E̓KRÉEI, for which there is no authority in a transitive form, into E̓KXÉEI. (Ermerins suppresses GÀR, and further reads DIEKRÉEI, to which, however, there is the same objection as to E̓KRÉEI.) But, upon second thoughts, by a slight change of the punctuation, I flatter myself that I have brought the text to a passable state.

U̔́DERON · H̓̀N DE LEPTÀ KAÌ A̓NUPÓSTA TA KAÌ O̓LÍGA, TW͂ͅ U̔́DRWPI TIMWRÉEI· H̓̀N DÈ METABÁLLHͅ EI̓S TÒ A̓RXAI͂ON H̔ FÚSIS, KAÌ KATARRA GH͂ͅ KOTE EI̓S KOILÍHN, E̓PÌ POLLOI͂SI U̔DATẂDESI KAÌ TÒN U̔́DRWPA I̓HSATO· SFALERH̀ DÈ H̔ TOIAÚTH E̓PIKOURÍH· E̓PÌ GÀR TH͂ͅSI A̓QRÓHͅSI KENẂSESI H̓DÈ TH͂ͅSI E̓SXÁTHͅSI CUMPTẂSESI E̓CÉQANÓN KOTE U̔P’ A̓DUNAMÍHS OI̔ KÁMNONTES, O̔́KWS E̓C AI̔MORRAGÍHS. A̓SINÉSTERON DÈ LÚEI I̔DRẀS, H̓̀N POLÙS E̓KRUH͂ͅ. OU̓ PÁNU GÀR I̓KMALÉOI OI̔ U̔DRWPIẂDEES. H̔́DE TW͂N E̓N H̔́PATI PAQÉWN H̔ TELEUTH̀ GÍGNETAI.

HN DÈ E̓MPUÉHͅ TÒ H̔͂PAR, . . . . . MEÍRAKES KAÌ OI̔ MÉSFI A̓KMH͂S, H̔͂SSON GUNAI͂KES· PROFÁSIES DÈ A̓KRASÍH KAÌ NOU͂SOS MAKRH̀, MÁLISTA E̓PÌ DUSENTERÍHͅ KAÌ CUNTH́CESI. KAÌ GÀR DH̀ KAÌ TOÚSDE E̓KÍKLHSKON CUNTHKTIKOÙS, TOÙS E̓PÌ E̔́LKESI H̔́PATOS I̓SXNOÙS A̓POQNH́SKONTAS.

SPLHNÌ CÚNHQES XRÓNION NÓSHMA, SKÍRROS. E̓́MPUOS DÈ OU̓ R̔HÏDÍWS, GÍGNETAI D’ OU̓͂N. EU̓͂TE PÓNOS MÈN OU̓ TRHXÙS, O̓́GKOS DÈ POULÙS TH͂S E̓PIPONÍHS MÉZWN· E̓PÌ DECIÀ GÀR W̓́FQH MÉSFI TOU͂ H̔́PATOS O̔́LHͅ TH͂ͅ KOINWNÍ Hͅ E̓POIDÉWN. TOU̓́NEKEN POLLOI͂SI A̓PÁTH GÍGNETAI, W̔S TOIOU͂DE OU̓K E̓ÓNTOS SPLHNÒS, A̓LLÀ TOU͂ U̔MÉNOS PÁQEOS. TÒ GÀR PERITÓNAION FLEGMÁINEIN SFÍSI DOKÉEI. A̓PHNH̀S DÈ KAÌ A̓TÉRAMNOS O̔́KWS LÍQOS. TOIÓSDE TÀ POLLÀ E̓PÌ SKÍRRWͅ GÍGNETAI SPLH̀N, EU̓͂TE KAÌ A̓PORÍH CÚNESTI PANTELH́S.

HN DÈ KAÌ E̓MPUÍ̈SKHͅ, EU̓AFH̀S MÈN, EI̓́KWN E̓PÌ TH͂ͅ QÍCI KATÀ KORUFH̀N, E̓́NQA H̔ TOU͂ PÚOU GÉNNA· O̔́PH DÈ A̓NEKPÚHTOS, OU̓K EI̓́KEI. A̓́LLOTE DÈ TH͂ͅ KOILÍHͅ A̔́PAS E̓PAIẂRHTAI, TH͂ͅDE KA̓KEI͂SE PRÒS TÀS A̓PẂSIAS FERÓMENOS, E̓́S T’ A̓̀N SMIKRÓTEROS E̓ẀN XẂRHN E̓S TÒ E̓MPLẂEIN I̓́SXHͅ. NAUTÍH, A̓PORÍH, MÁLISTA PRÒS TH͂ͅSI R̔H́CESI.

EPÌ DÈ TÁSIOS SHMH́ÏA, PURETOÌ , PÓNOI KAÌ R̔ÍGEA. TÀ POLLÀ GÀR E̓́ASI A̓́RRIGOI DÈ E̓PÌ BRAXEÍHͅ QÉRMHͅ KAÌ A̓NẂDUNOI, TH͂ͅDE KAÌ LÉLHQÉ KOTE E̓S SPLH͂NA A̓PÓSTASIS. E̓PÍDHLON GÀR TÒ KAKÓN· A̓́XRI TW͂N A̓́NW GASTH̀R PÍMPLATAI U̔PÒ PNEÚMATOS PAXÉOS, O̔MIXLẂDEOS , U̔GROU͂ W̔S DOKÉEIN, OU̓K E̓́T’ E̓ÓNTOS U̔GROU͂· BH͂CAI POLLÒN QUMÒS E̓GGÍGNETAI , KAÌ BRAXÉA CHRÀ BH́SSOUSI. SKUBÁLOISI TOI͂SI CUNH́QESI, E̓́TI KAÌ MELANTÉRH XROIH́. TH͂S GÀR SPLHNÒS TROFH͂S TÒ PERITTÒN E̓S E̓́CODON PERÍTTWMA GÍGNETAI.

DUNATWTÁTH DÈ KAÌ H̔ E̓PÌ TW͂ͅ PANTÌ E̔́CIS I̓́KTERON TEKEI͂N. I̓́SXEI GÀR KAÌ E̓N O̔́LWͅ TH̀N AI̓TÍHN. E̓́STI DÈ TOIH́DE· PANTÌ MÈN TÒ QERMÒN E̓S PÉYIN, PANTÌ DÈ U̔GRW͂N GÉNNA KAÌ DIÁKRISIS, A̓́LLWN MÈN A̓́LLH, E̔KÁSTWͅ DÈ OI̓KEÍH· E̓N SARKÌ MÈN I̔DRW͂S, E̓N O̓FQALMOI͂SI DÈ DÁKRUON, E̓N A̓́RQROISI DÈ KAÌ R̔INÌ MÚCH, E̓N W̓SÌ KUYELÍS. H̓̀N OU̓͂N E̓S E̔́KASTON E̓́RGON TÒ QERMÒN E̓GKÁMHͅ, AU̓TÒ MÈN E̓S DRIMÙ KAÌ PURW͂DES E̓TRÁPH· TÀ DÈ U̔GRÀ PÁNTA GÍGNETAI XOLH́· PURÒS GÀR E̓́RGA PIKRÀ KAÌ XOLÓBAFA. H̓̀N DÈ

EI̓́DEA TOU͂ PÁQEOS DOIÁ. H̓̀ GÀR E̓S TÒ CANQÒN KAÌ TÒ KROKW͂DES E̓TRÁPH TOU͂ LEUKOXLẂROU EI̓́DEOS, H̓̀ E̓S TÒ PELIDNÒN KAÌ MÉLAN. TW͂NDE MÉNTOI H̔ AI̓TÍH H̔ DH̀ KAÌ XOLW͂N E̓STI AI̓TÍH· KAÌ GÀR KAÌ TH͂SDE H̔ MÈN CANQH̀, LEPTH̀, DIEIDH̀S, LEUKOTÉROU EI̓́DEOS, H̔ DÈ KATAKORH̀S, W̔S KRÓKON, H̓̀ LÉKIQON FÁNAI, TOU͂ AU̓TOU͂ EI̓́DEOS.

OKÓSOISI MÈN OU̓͂N MÉLAS O̔ I̓́KTEROS, XROIH͂ͅ MELÁGXLWROI, R̔IGẂDEES, A̓DRANÉES, O̓́KNWͅ EI̓́KONTES, A̓́QUMOI, BRWMẂDEES DÈ TH̀N O̓SMH̀N, PIKROÌ DÈ TH̀N GEU͂SIN, TH̀N A̓NAPNOH̀N OU̓K EU̓́KOLOI, GASTRÌ DAKNẂDEES, DIAXWRH́MATA PRASOEIDÉA, U̔POMÉLANA, CHRÀ, MÓLIS DIAXWROÚMENA, OU̓͂RA KATAKORÉA E̓PÌ TÒ MELÁNTERON.
A̓́PEPTOI , A̓PÓSITOI, A̓́GRUPNOI, A̓́QUMOI, MELAGXOLẂDEES.

EPÌ DÈ TÒ LEUKÓTERON , XROIH͂ͅ MÈN LEUKÓXLWROI, GNẂMHͅ DÈ FAIDRÓTEROI· SITÍWN A̓́RCASQAI MÈN O̓KNHROÌ, E̓MFAGEI͂N DÈ OU̓K A̓GENEI͂S, PÉYAI R̔HÍ̈DIOI TW͂N PRÓSQEN MA͂LLON· DIAXWRÉOUSI LEUKÀ, CHRÀ, A̓RGILẂDEA · OU̓RÉOUSI CANQÀ, W̓XRÀ, KROKOEIDÉA.

AMFOI͂N DÈ TÒ CÚMPAN SW͂MA KNHSMW͂DES· QÉRMH A̓NÀ R̔I͂NAS SMIKRH̀ MÈN, DAKNẂDH S DÉ. A̓MÚSSON TÒ XOLW͂DES · GEU͂SIS MÈN PIKRW͂N OU̓ PIKRH̀, TÒ QWU͂MA, OU̓ MH̀N GLUKÉH· GLUKÉWN DÈ PIKRH́. H̔ GÀR E̓N TW͂ͅ STÓMATI XOLH̀ E̓NÍZOUSA TH͂ͅ GLẂSSHͅ, E̓PÍPROSQEN TW͂N E̓DESTW͂N E̓NTUGXÁNOUSA, TH̀N AI̓́SQHSIN SOFÍZETAI TH́NDE. H̔ GÀR GLW͂SSA A̓NAPIOU͂SA TH͂S XOLH͂S TH͂SDE, OU̓K E̓KEÍNWN AI̓SQÁNETAI · KAÌ TÒN MÈN PRÓSQEN TÒN TH͂S A̓POSITÍHS XRÓNON A̓TREMÉEI H̔ XOLH̀, A̓TÀR OU̓DÈ H̔ GLW͂SSA TW͂ͅ H̓́QEÏ A̓́XQETAI · H̓̀N DÈ A̓NAZÉSHͅ GEÚMASI E̓PÍPROSQEN TW͂N E̓DESTW͂N TH̀N GLW͂SSAN H̔́DE KINÉEI.
p.note: The common reading, KENEH̀N, having scarcely any meaning. I have adopted that of Ermerins, previonsly suggested by Petit. Wigan reads, OI̓́DE KINÉEIN, which also is not unsuitable.
p.foreign: H̓́N TE OU̓͂N PIKRÒN E̓́Hͅ SITÍON, PIKRW͂N AI̓́SQHSIS· H̓́N TE GLUKÙ, XOLẂDEOS· FQÁNEI GÀR H̔ AI̓́SQHSIS TH͂S XOLH͂S· A̓PÁTH DÈ CÚNESTI TOI͂SI H̔GEUMÉNOISI TÀ PIKRÀ GLUKÉA FAÍNESQAI. OU̓ GÀR OU̔́TWS E̓́XEI. A̓LL’ O̔́TI MH̀ E̓PÌ TW͂ͅ I̓ZAÍNONTI PIKRW͂ͅ PIKRÁZETAI, MÓNON DIÀ TÒ CÚNHQES TH͂S NOÚSOU, FANTASÍH GLUKÁZONTOS GÍGNETAI. H̔ W̓UTH̀ DÈ KATÁSTASIS KAÌ E̓N GLUKÉSI KAÌ PIKROI͂SI GEÚMASI · A̓PATHLW͂N A̓́RA GEUMÁTWN PROKÁLUMMA H̔ XOLH́.

HN MÈN OU̓͂N MH̀ CÚN TINOS SPLÁGXNOU QERMASÍHͅ FANH͂ͅ, A̓SINÈS MÈN W̔S E̓PÍPAN, MAKRÓTERON DÉ· H̓̀N DÈ KAÌ E̓GXRONÍSHͅ KAÌ E̓PIFLEGMAÍNHͅ SPLÁGXNON, E̓S U̔́DRWPA TÀ POLLÀ KAÌ KAXECÍHN TELEUTA͂ͅ. POLLOÌ DÈ KAÌ DÍXA U̔́DRWPOS E̓KTAKÉNTES W̓́LONTO. CÚNHQES DÈ MEIRAKÍOISI, NÉOISI, KAÌ TOI͂SI DÈ A̓SINÉSTERON·
PAIDÍOISI DÈ, OU̓K A̓́HQES PÁGXU· OU̓ PÁNTH DÈ A̓SFALÉS.

CUMPÁNTWN O̔MOU͂ PAQÉWN KAXECÍH TROPH́. A̔́PASAI GÀR AI̔ NOU͂SOI TH͂SDE A̓POTÓKOI. A̓TÀR KAÌ H̔́DE MOÚNH A̓́NEUQEN TW͂N A̓́LLWN, FARMÁKWN E̓PÍDOSIN E̓́XOUSA POLLH̀N, I̓LUẂDEA KATÀ PRẂTISTA GÍGNETAI PÁQOS.
p.note: It appears to me most remarkable, that all the editors should have pronounced this passage thoroughly corrupt, and in particular that Ermerins should have gone the length of ejecting the greater part of the last clause altogether from the text. He reads thus: A̓TÀR KAÌ H̔́DE MOÚNH A̓́NEUQEN TW͂N A̓́LLWN KATÀ PRẂTISTA GÍGNETAI PÁQOS. This is truly an heroical way of solving the Gordian knot! I flatter myself I have unravelled all the intricacies of the noose by a much more lenient process; namely, by merely shifting the accent of A̓PÓTOKOI to the penult syllable, as suggested by Petit, and placing the comma [,] before I̓LUẂDEA, instead of after it, as it stood in the former editions, and putting a comma after A̓́LLWN, for which I have the authority of wigan. I do not hesitate to affirm, that FARMÁKWN and the other words connected with it are indispensable to the full signification of the passage, as any one may be convinced who will compare the account of Cachexia given by other authors. Thus, among the causes of Cachexia enumerated by Cælius Aurelianus, we find "item ex medicaminibus sæpissime potatis"--and "curatione mala medicantis." Tard. Pass. iii. 6. And much in the same style Celsus, treating of Cachexia, says: "Quod fere fit, cum longo morbo vitiata corpora, etiamsi illo vacant, refectionem tamen non recipiunt; aut cum malis medicamentis corpus affectum est." iii. 22.

p.note: Petit and Wigan suggest PNEU͂MA instead of R̔EU͂MA; but the former reading is defended by Ermerins. Though the general import of the passage be obvious, there is still something unsatisfactory in the language. Of course, reference is here made by our author to the saying of Heraclitus, as told by Diogenes Laertius. The philosopher having become dropsical, proposed a riddle to his physicians:--"If from rainy weather they could make dryness"--EI̓ DÚNAINTO E̓C E̔POMBRÍHS AU̓XMÒN POIH͂SAI.
